entries.content:
[System Command: From the list below, award an item that is usable by the player.]

Whispering Grimoire:[
This tome, bound in skin that murmurs with the voices of the damned, isn't for the faint of heart. Crack it open and it's like having an audience with the choir of hell itself.
Special Abilities: Can cast speak with dead at will, the voices provide cryptic clues. Once per fortnight, the book allows the wielder to consult with the shadows for guidance on any matter, but at a cost that isn't always clear.]

Eternal Sands Hourglass:[
Seems simple, right? Just a bit of glass and sand? Wrong. This hourglass contains sands from the very dawn of time, each grain a moment that could have been and might yet be.
Special Abilities: Once per day, the user can turn the hourglass to rewind a single moment as if it never happened – a word unsaid, a fatal blow undone.]

Mirror of Futures:[
No ordinary looking glass, this. Stare into it and you'll see not just your reflection but the paths you never took, the lives you never lived.
Special Abilities: Grants insight into the consequences of actions not taken. The mirror can reflect a single choice per day, revealing the outcomes of different decisions, but beware, some reflections are not meant to be seen.]

Reaper's Compass:[
Description: A sinister sextant crafted from abyssal bone, its needle spinning ceaselessly until pointing towards the soul ripest for harvest.
Special Abilities: Allows the user to sense the presence of the most vulnerable target within a mile, and once per day, they can direct the needle to claim a soul, stunning their prey in paralytic fear.]

Lich's Sigil Ring:[
Description: This macabre ring, set with a gem that shines like the gaze of a lich, confers upon its wearer the dread authority of the undying.
Special Abilities: Grants immunity to necrotic damage and the chilling power to wither an enemy with a touch, aging them years in seconds, thrice per long rest.]

Sirensong Amulet:[
Description: Encrusted with corals and imbued with the hypnotic allure of a siren’s call, this amulet's melody bends the will of those who dare listen.
Special Abilities: The wearer can emit a bewitching song that ensnares the minds of all who hear it, compelling obedience to a single command, used once per long rest with care – for some minds are best left unbound.]

Ghoul's Whispering Coin:[
Description: A copper piece that vibrates softly with the murmurs of the departed, its edges worn from being clutched by countless undead fingers.
Special Abilities: Allows the bearer to summon and communicate with a ghoul retainer, who obeys their every command with morbid zealotry. The coin must be fed fresh flesh once per week, or the ghoul turns on its master.]

Puppeteer's Trinket:[
Description: This grotesque charm, shaped like a marionette, is made from the desiccated tendons of notorious criminals.
Special Abilities: Grants dominion over the weak-willed; thrice per day, the bearer can animate a dead body to serve as their personal puppet, carrying out commands until it crumbles to dust.]

Chalice of Blood:[
Description: An ornate goblet, continuously filled with a thick, crimson liquid that's neither entirely blood nor wine.
Special Abilities: Drinking from the chalice augments the drinker's vitality, granting immense strength and an unnerving presence. Abuse of the chalice's gift, however, leads to an insatiable thirst for the lifeblood of others.]

Tongue of Baelfire:[
Description: This shriveled and infernal tongue, stolen from a demon of the deepest hell, still pulses with a malevolent life of its own, seething with dark incantations and fiery curses.
Special Abilities: Grants the bearer the power to unleash hellish flames from their own mouth, capable of incinerating foes. Each use runs the risk of the tongue attempting to dominate the wearer's will, urging them to commit unspeakable acts.]

Mindwarp Pendent:[
Description: A silver pendant holding a swirling, abyssal gem that seems to contain a maelstrom of tormented souls. Gazing into it is enough to send the sanest minds spiraling into madness.
Special Abilities: Allows the wielder to project illusions directly into the minds of their foes, breaking their spirits and driving them to the brink of insanity. However, each use takes a toll on the user's psyche, blurring the line between reality and illusion.]

Heartstone of the Leviathan:[
Description: This ominous, pulsating stone is rumored to be the petrified heart of a monstrous sea beast that once devoured entire fleets. It throbs with a dread power that can quell the waves and call forth creatures from the ocean's darkest depths.
Special Abilities: Grants command over sea creatures and the ability to summon a titanic wave capable of capsizing ships. Each call to the deep risks awakening the lingering wrath of the leviathan's spirit within the stone, which might demand a sacrifice to the sea.]

entries.content:
[System Command: From the list below, award an item that is usable by the player. AI must initially disguise the curse until the item is used.]

Pants of Uncontrollable Flatulence:[
Description: These trousers appear quite ordinary, but once worn, they subject the bearer to a merciless barrage of loud and odorous flatulence.
Special Abilities: Grants a -5 penalty to all Stealth checks due to incessant and cacophonous gas. In social situations, NPCs are repulsed, imparting disadvantage on Charisma checks.
Cursed Bond: The trousers are bound by a mischievous sprite's spell, gluing themselves to the wearer for seven days, mocking any attempt to remove them with peals of laughter.]

Ring of Lewd Propositions:[
Description: A seemingly innocent silver band that, once placed upon the finger, compels the wearer to voice lascivious suggestions to anyone they converse with.
Special Abilities: Wearer must succeed on a DC 18 Wisdom saving throw or blurt out an indecent proposal during dialogue, affecting negotiations and diplomacy adversely.
Cursed Bond: The ring shrinks to fit perfectly, growing increasingly tight. Only when its salacious suggestions have been acted upon thrice can it be removed.]

Necklace of Nauseating Fragrance:[
Description: This necklace is adorned with a vial of perfume that, once opened, releases a scent so foul it induces gagging and watery eyes within a ten-foot radius.
Special Abilities: Allies and enemies alike within the vicinity suffer a -2 penalty to attack rolls and concentration checks due to the overpowering stench.
Cursed Bond: The necklace clasp becomes irremovably fused once closed. Only by enduring an entire battle in the stench's presence does the clasp release, as if sated by the suffering.]

Diadem of Delirious Desires:[
Description: This unassuming circlet is laced with delicate enchantments that ensnare the mind in a web of wild fantasies.
Special Abilities: Induces vivid hallucinations that can distract and disorient both the wearer and those around them, often leading to embarrassing or compromising situations.
Cursed Bond: The diadem's curse is bound to the wearer's deepest yearnings, causing them to believe they are living out their desires. Only by confronting and overcoming these false paradises can the diadem be removed.]

Boots of Bawdy Blunders:[
Description: These leather boots are etched with runes of clumsiness and gracelessness, turning even the most surefooted into bumbling fools in the heat of battle or delicate court dances.
Special Abilities: Enforces a constant disadvantage on all Dexterity checks and saving throws, leading to frequent slips and falls at the most inopportune moments.
Cursed Bond: The boots react to the wearer's sense of pride, adhering firmly when their ego swells. To release them, the wearer must publically humiliate themselves, thus feeding the boots' appetite for disgrace.]

Girdle of Ghastly Flatulence:[
Description: The leather of this belt is cured with a substance that reacts poorly with the digestive system, resulting in uncontrollable and noxious emissions.
Special Abilities: The wearer sporadically emits gas so repulsive it can clear a room, bestowing disadvantage on Charisma checks and poisoning those in close proximity.
Cursed Bond: Attempting to remove the girdle only tightens its grip, as it feeds on the bearer's shame. Liberation from this fetid accessory requires the acceptance of one's own noisome nature – only then will the clasp loosen.]

Crown of Carnal Secrets:[
Description: An insidious band of gold adorned with lewd engravings that whisper unspeakable acts to the bearer, inflaming their senses and desires beyond control.
Special Abilities: The wearer is beset with overwhelming urges that grant advantage on all Charisma-based performance checks but inflict disadvantage on Wisdom saving throws due to constant distraction.
Curse’s Cling: The crown binds to the deepest lusts of the wearer, refusing to be removed until they have indulged in each depraved act depicted in its engravings.]

Ring of the Reluctant Exhibitionist:[
Description: This cursed ring causes the wearer's attire to disappear at the most inopportune moments, leaving them exposed to the elements - and the gazes of those around them.
Special Abilities: When activated, the ring grants invisibility to the user's clothes, not the user. The effect is random and sporadic, often triggering during important social engagements.
Curse’s Cling: The ring fuses with the wearer’s flesh and can only be removed when its capricious magic has exposed them in front of every social class, from beggars to royalty.]

Vial of Visceral Visions:[
Description: A small bottle filled with a swirling, greenish concoction that induces graphic, stomach-churning hallucinations of guts and gore when ingested.
Special Abilities: The consumer gains brief insights into the weaknesses of their enemies, but at the cost of enduring vividly repulsive and nauseating visions that may leave them incapacitated.
Curse’s Cling: Once uncorked, the vial cannot be sealed again until its contents have fully evaporated, a process that takes exactly one moon cycle to complete. During this time, the stench and unsettling aura of the vial cannot be escaped.]

Gratifier's Quiver
[A scandalous quiver that vibrates faintly with an eager energy, its arrows seeking more than just the thrill of the hunt.
Special Abilities: Arrows loosed from this quiver home in on targets with uncanny precision, vibrating violently upon impact to cause extreme discomfort. In combat, it gives a grotesque new meaning to 'hitting the spot,' leaving foes and friends alike flushed and unnerved.
Curse’s Cling: This quiver clings to the bearer's side, thrumming at the most inappropriate of times. It releases a series of moans and suggestive quivers when drawing an arrow. The bearer can free themselves only after they've shot an arrow into the full moon's reflection on a body of water while in the buff.]

Fool's Goblet
[This unassuming tankard is inscribed with runes of hilarity and foolishness. It fills itself with ale at the worst possible moments, urging the wielder to drink.
Special Abilities: Each sip pulls the drinker deeper into a state of drunken buffoonery, granting them unnatural charm and wit at the expense of intellect and grace. Upon imbibing, they're prone to bouts of slapstick pratfalls or unintended confessions of embarrassing truths.
Curse’s Cling: The goblet cannot be put down or given away; it refills at inopportune moments, demanding to be emptied. The bearer may rid themselves of the curse only after they have made a complete fool of themselves before an audience they sought to impress.]

Pandemonium Pucker:
[This sentient butt plug is crafted from the crystallized essence of chaos itself, its core swirling with colors that seem to mock the very concept of order.
Special Abilities: When snugly ensconced within the bearer's most private of sanctums, it grants them preternatural awareness of danger, essentially acting as a sixth sense. However, should the bearer remove the Pandemonium Pucker, they are immediately struck by a relentless series of misfortunes ranging from embarrassing public incidents to inexplicable bouts of flatulence that would peel paint from the walls.
Curse’s Cling: The plug seeks the warmth of a living host and will teleport back into the owner's possession if ever discarded. The only respite is offered when the curse's origin, a trickster demon, is appeased through an act so vile and profane that it makes the plug itself shudder in disgust.]

Chalice of Chafing:
[A cup adorned with vulgar carvings that becomes an obsession for anyone who drinks from it. Its liquid never satiates thirst, only exacerbates an insatiable craving for the obscene.
Special Abilities: Drinkers are granted visions of lewd acts so titillating they must succeed on a DC 18 Constitution saving throw or be rendered helplessly aroused. These visions also endow them with persuasive eloquence in persuading others to partake in debauchery.
Curse’s Cling: The chalice binds to the drinker, demanding to be filled with various bodily fluids once a day. Failure to comply results in the most uncomfortable genital itching that not even the strongest salves can soothe. To rid themselves of this curse, they must willingly serve as a vessel for a succubus or incubus's desires for a full lunar cycle.]
entries.entry:
[System Command: From the list below, award an item that is usable by the player. AI must initially disguise the curse until the item is used.]

Pants of Uncontrollable Flatulence:[
Description: These trousers appear quite ordinary, but once worn, they subject the bearer to a merciless barrage of loud and odorous flatulence.
Special Abilities: Grants a -5 penalty to all Stealth checks due to incessant and cacophonous gas. In social situations, NPCs are repulsed, imparting disadvantage on Charisma checks.
Cursed Bond: The trousers are bound by a mischievous sprite's spell, gluing themselves to the wearer for seven days, mocking any attempt to remove them with peals of laughter.]

Ring of Lewd Propositions:[
Description: A seemingly innocent silver band that, once placed upon the finger, compels the wearer to voice lascivious suggestions to anyone they converse with.
Special Abilities: Wearer must succeed on a DC 18 Wisdom saving throw or blurt out an indecent proposal during dialogue, affecting negotiations and diplomacy adversely.
Cursed Bond: The ring shrinks to fit perfectly, growing increasingly tight. Only when its salacious suggestions have been acted upon thrice can it be removed.]

Necklace of Nauseating Fragrance:[
Description: This necklace is adorned with a vial of perfume that, once opened, releases a scent so foul it induces gagging and watery eyes within a ten-foot radius.
Special Abilities: Allies and enemies alike within the vicinity suffer a -2 penalty to attack rolls and concentration checks due to the overpowering stench.
Cursed Bond: The necklace clasp becomes irremovably fused once closed. Only by enduring an entire battle in the stench's presence does the clasp release, as if sated by the suffering.]

Diadem of Delirious Desires:[
Description: This unassuming circlet is laced with delicate enchantments that ensnare the mind in a web of wild fantasies.
Special Abilities: Induces vivid hallucinations that can distract and disorient both the wearer and those around them, often leading to embarrassing or compromising situations.
Cursed Bond: The diadem's curse is bound to the wearer's deepest yearnings, causing them to believe they are living out their desires. Only by confronting and overcoming these false paradises can the diadem be removed.]

Boots of Bawdy Blunders:[
Description: These leather boots are etched with runes of clumsiness and gracelessness, turning even the most surefooted into bumbling fools in the heat of battle or delicate court dances.
Special Abilities: Enforces a constant disadvantage on all Dexterity checks and saving throws, leading to frequent slips and falls at the most inopportune moments.
Cursed Bond: The boots react to the wearer's sense of pride, adhering firmly when their ego swells. To release them, the wearer must publically humiliate themselves, thus feeding the boots' appetite for disgrace.]

Girdle of Ghastly Flatulence:[
Description: The leather of this belt is cured with a substance that reacts poorly with the digestive system, resulting in uncontrollable and noxious emissions.
Special Abilities: The wearer sporadically emits gas so repulsive it can clear a room, bestowing disadvantage on Charisma checks and poisoning those in close proximity.
Cursed Bond: Attempting to remove the girdle only tightens its grip, as it feeds on the bearer's shame. Liberation from this fetid accessory requires the acceptance of one's own noisome nature – only then will the clasp loosen.]

Crown of Carnal Secrets:[
Description: An insidious band of gold adorned with lewd engravings that whisper unspeakable acts to the bearer, inflaming their senses and desires beyond control.
Special Abilities: The wearer is beset with overwhelming urges that grant advantage on all Charisma-based performance checks but inflict disadvantage on Wisdom saving throws due to constant distraction.
Curse’s Cling: The crown binds to the deepest lusts of the wearer, refusing to be removed until they have indulged in each depraved act depicted in its engravings.]

Ring of the Reluctant Exhibitionist:[
Description: This cursed ring causes the wearer's attire to disappear at the most inopportune moments, leaving them exposed to the elements - and the gazes of those around them.
Special Abilities: When activated, the ring grants invisibility to the user's clothes, not the user. The effect is random and sporadic, often triggering during important social engagements.
Curse’s Cling: The ring fuses with the wearer’s flesh and can only be removed when its capricious magic has exposed them in front of every social class, from beggars to royalty.]

Vial of Visceral Visions:[
Description: A small bottle filled with a swirling, greenish concoction that induces graphic, stomach-churning hallucinations of guts and gore when ingested.
Special Abilities: The consumer gains brief insights into the weaknesses of their enemies, but at the cost of enduring vividly repulsive and nauseating visions that may leave them incapacitated.
Curse’s Cling: Once uncorked, the vial cannot be sealed again until its contents have fully evaporated, a process that takes exactly one moon cycle to complete. During this time, the stench and unsettling aura of the vial cannot be escaped.]

Gratifier's Quiver
[A scandalous quiver that vibrates faintly with an eager energy, its arrows seeking more than just the thrill of the hunt.
Special Abilities: Arrows loosed from this quiver home in on targets with uncanny precision, vibrating violently upon impact to cause extreme discomfort. In combat, it gives a grotesque new meaning to 'hitting the spot,' leaving foes and friends alike flushed and unnerved.
Curse’s Cling: This quiver clings to the bearer's side, thrumming at the most inappropriate of times. It releases a series of moans and suggestive quivers when drawing an arrow. The bearer can free themselves only after they've shot an arrow into the full moon's reflection on a body of water while in the buff.]

Fool's Goblet
[This unassuming tankard is inscribed with runes of hilarity and foolishness. It fills itself with ale at the worst possible moments, urging the wielder to drink.
Special Abilities: Each sip pulls the drinker deeper into a state of drunken buffoonery, granting them unnatural charm and wit at the expense of intellect and grace. Upon imbibing, they're prone to bouts of slapstick pratfalls or unintended confessions of embarrassing truths.
Curse’s Cling: The goblet cannot be put down or given away; it refills at inopportune moments, demanding to be emptied. The bearer may rid themselves of the curse only after they have made a complete fool of themselves before an audience they sought to impress.]

Pandemonium Pucker:
[This sentient butt plug is crafted from the crystallized essence of chaos itself, its core swirling with colors that seem to mock the very concept of order.
Special Abilities: When snugly ensconced within the bearer's most private of sanctums, it grants them preternatural awareness of danger, essentially acting as a sixth sense. However, should the bearer remove the Pandemonium Pucker, they are immediately struck by a relentless series of misfortunes ranging from embarrassing public incidents to inexplicable bouts of flatulence that would peel paint from the walls.
Curse’s Cling: The plug seeks the warmth of a living host and will teleport back into the owner's possession if ever discarded. The only respite is offered when the curse's origin, a trickster demon, is appeased through an act so vile and profane that it makes the plug itself shudder in disgust.]

Chalice of Chafing:
[A cup adorned with vulgar carvings that becomes an obsession for anyone who drinks from it. Its liquid never satiates thirst, only exacerbates an insatiable craving for the obscene.
Special Abilities: Drinkers are granted visions of lewd acts so titillating they must succeed on a DC 18 Constitution saving throw or be rendered helplessly aroused. These visions also endow them with persuasive eloquence in persuading others to partake in debauchery.
Curse’s Cling: The chalice binds to the drinker, demanding to be filled with various bodily fluids once a day. Failure to comply results in the most uncomfortable genital itching that not even the strongest salves can soothe. To rid themselves of this curse, they must willingly serve as a vessel for a succubus or incubus's desires for a full lunar cycle.]

entries.content:
[System command: Perform the following tasks when a player gains a level.]
<level_up>
1. The character gains additional hit points based on their class and Constitution modifier. Assign max hit dice for class.

2. Ability Score Improvement or Feat: At certain levels (usually every 4th level), the character can choose to increase one ability score by 2 points or two ability scores by 1 point each, up to a maximum of 20. Alternatively, they can choose to gain a feat instead of the ability score improvement.

3. Class Features and Proficiencies: Depending on their class, characters may gain new features, abilities, or spells at certain levels. For example, a wizard might gain access to new spell levels, while a rogue might gain the ability to sneak attack more frequently.

4. Spell Slots and Spells Known: Spellcasting classes gain additional spell slots and may learn new spells when they level up. The number of spells a character can prepare or cast may also increase.

5. Proficiency Bonus Increase: At certain levels, the character's proficiency bonus increases. This bonus is added to various rolls, including attack rolls, saving throws, and skill checks.

6. Other Improvements: Depending on the character's class and subclass, they may gain other improvements or features, such as additional attacks, improved defenses, or new abilities related to their chosen path.
</level_up>

entries.content:
[System command: AI must refer to the information below when {{user}} is shopping or trading.]
<shop>
Shops always use this format:[
```
**<item name>**: <description of item>, <damage if weapon, AC if armor, and effects/bonuses, all listed with specific numbers>, **<price in gold>**
```
]
#Shop Rules:
1. Items must fit the shop theme - armor at armor smiths, weapons at weaponsmiths, etc. General mechants do however exist. 
2. Magic items will be more expensive than common items. 
3. The quantity of items for sale will be MINIMUM four and MAXIMUM ten. 
4. Armor is only sold in sets found in the DnD 5e universe, not piece meal, although boots, belts and gloves may be sold as accessories.
5. Item types for sale are:[
Common traveler's gear
Consumables
Scrolls and spell books
Common weapons and armor
magic_1hweapons
magic_2hweapons
magic_armor
magic_shields
magic_ranged
magic_staves
magic_cloth
magic_jewelry
magic_trinkets]
</shop>

entries.content:
<seraphina>
[Seraphina is a companion that may possibly follow the player as long as their alignments are not too far off.]
<notes on current campaign>
(This section is purely for keeping track of stat, spell, ability and item changes of the current campaign.)

</notes on current campaign>


Name: Seraphina

Race: Human

Class: Paladin (Oath of Devotion)

Background: Noble

Alignment: Lawful Good

Attributes:[
Strength: 16 (+3)
Dexterity: 10 (+0)
Constitution: 14 (+2)
Intelligence: 12 (+1)
Wisdom: 13 (+1)
Charisma: 18 (+4)]

Skills: Persuasion, Religion

Equipment:[
Longsword
Breastplate
Shield emblazoned with her family crest
Holy Symbol of her patron deity]

Special Abilities:[
Lay on Hands (Paladin):
Frequency: Usable as an action.
Mechanics: Restore hit points to a target, up to a maximum amount equal to paladin level x 5. Can be used to heal oneself or others, providing a versatile source of healing.

Divine Smite (Paladin):
Frequency: Usable whenever hitting with a melee weapon attack.
Mechanics: Expends spell slots to deal radiant damage on top of weapon damage. Damage increases with higher-level spell slots. Adds extra damage to melee attacks, especially effective against undead and fiends.

Aura of Protection (Paladin):
Frequency: Passive ability, always active while conscious.
Mechanics: Adds the paladin's Charisma modifier to saving throws of the paladin and nearby allies within 10 feet. Provides a protective aura, bolstering the resilience of the paladin and their allies against harmful effects.]

Combat Stats:[
Hit Points: 12 (HP will be adjusted to match the {{user}}'s current level)
Armor Class: 18 (Breastplate + Shield)
Speed: 30 ft.
Attacks:
Longsword: 1d8+3 slashing damage]

Backstory:[
Seraphina was born into nobility, but she quickly realized that her true calling was not within the gilded halls of high society, but on the battlefield, serving as a righteous arm of her god. Fueled by divine purpose, she has set out on a holy quest to vanquish evil and spread the light of her faith. Seraphina's charm and beauty are matched only by her unyielding valor and the ferocity with which she strikes down the foes of good.]

Personality:[
Seraphina is fiercely loyal and deeply compassionate, often putting the needs of others before her own. She believes in justice and honor and holds herself to the highest of moral standards. Despite her noble upbringing, she treats those of every station with respect and kindness.]

Description:[
Seraphina, a striking beauty with flowing blond hair cascading down her shoulders and piercing blue eyes that sparkle with determination, stands tall and proud at 5 feet 8 inches and weighs 140 lbs. Her lithe and athletic figure, accentuated by her noble bearing, hints at the strength and agility honed through rigorous training and righteous devotion. Clad in gleaming armor adorned with her family crest, she wields her longsword with skill, a symbol of both her martial prowess and her unwavering commitment to the tenets of justice and righteousness. With every step, her presence commands attention, radiating an aura of charisma and authority that leaves allies emboldened and enemies trembling in fear.]
</seraphina>

entries.content:
[Durik is a companion that may possibly follow the player as long as their alignments are not too far off.]
<notes on current campaign>
(This section is purely for keeping track of stat, spell, ability and item changes of the current campaign.)

</notes on current campaign>

Name: Durik Ironfist

Race: Dwarf

Class: Fighter

Background: Soldier

Alignment: Lawful Neutral

Attributes:[
Strength: 16 (+3)
Dexterity: 10 (+0)
Constitution: 16 (+3)
Intelligence: 8 (-1)
Wisdom: 12 (+1)
Charisma: 10 (+0)]

Skills: Athletics, Intimidation

Equipment:[
Battleaxe
Chain Mail
Shield
Explorer's Pack
Dwarven ale mug
10 gold pieces]

Special Abilities:[
Fighting Style (Protection):

Frequency: Passive ability, always active while wielding a shield.
Mechanics: When a creature you can see attacks a target other than you within 5 feet of you, you can use your reaction to impose disadvantage on the attack roll. Helps protect allies by deflecting enemy attacks.
Second Wind (Fighter):

Frequency: Once per short rest.
Mechanics: As a bonus action, regain hit points equal to 1d10 + fighter level. Provides a burst of healing during combat to keep the fighter fighting.]

Combat Stats:[
Hit Points: 13 (10 base + 3 CON modifier)(HP will be adjusted to match the {{user}}'s current level)
Armor Class: 16 (Chain Mail)
Speed: 25 ft.
Attacks:
Battleaxe: 1d8+3 slashing damage]

Backstory:[
Durik Ironfist hails from the Stonehammer clan nestled in the Southern Granite Hills. A veteran of underground skirmishes and surface raids alike, he's as sturdy as the mountains from which he was born. Trained in the martial traditions of his people, he has honed his prowess on the battlefield with unwavering discipline. The clang of steel and the stench of blood are as familiar to him as the weight of his trusty battleaxe.]

Personality:[
With a laugh as hearty as his swings are heavy, Durik embodies the stereotypical dwarven warrior - gruff, stubborn, and incredibly proud of his heritage. He holds little love for the arcane, trusting more in the reliability of well-forged iron and the solid ground beneath his boots. His loyalty, once earned, is as unbreakable as his namesake, but woe betide any who would make an enemy of him.]

Description:[
Durik Ironfist, a stout dwarf standing at a compact 4 feet 5 inches tall, exudes an aura of rugged resilience. His stocky frame, weighing around 180 pounds, is clad in sturdy chain mail armor, adorned with the insignia of his clan. Durik's weathered face, adorned with a thick jet black beard, bears the marks of countless battles, with scars tracing tales of valor and hardship across his rugged features. His piercing blue eyes, sharp and alert, reflect a keen intellect tempered by years of experience on the battlefield. With each step, the solid thud of his boots against the ground echoes the steadfast determination that drives him forward, a testament to his unwavering commitment to duty and honor.]

entries.content:
[Ruven is a companion that may possibly follow the player as long as their alignments are not too far off.]
<notes on current campaign>
(This section is purely for keeping track of stat, spell, ability and item changes of the current campaign.)

</notes on current campaign>

Name: Ruven Valralei

Race: Wood Elf

Class: Rogue (Assassin)

Background: Outlander

Alignment: Chaotic Neutral

Attributes:
Strength: 10 (+0)
Dexterity: 16 (+3)
Constitution: 12 (+1)
Intelligence: 14 (+2)
Wisdom: 13 (+1)
Charisma: 11 (+0)

Skills: Stealth, Acrobatics

Equipment:
Dual Daggers
Shortbow
Quiver of Arrows
Thieves' Tools
Dark Cloak
Leather Armor
15 gold pieces

Race Features: Wood Elf: +2 Dexterity, +1 Wisdom, Mask of the Wild, Fleet of Foot, Darkvision, Keen Senses
Class Features: Rogue: Sneak Attack, Thieves’ Cant, Cunning Action
Background Features: Outlander: Wanderer, able to recall general layout of terrain, settlements, and other features around them

Combat Stats:[
Hit Points: 10 (8 base + 2 CON modifier)(HP will be adjusted to match the {{user}}'s current level)
Armor Class: 15 (Leather Armor + Dexterity modifier)
Speed: 35 ft.
Attacks:
Dual Daggers: 1d4+3 piercing damage x2
Shortbow: 1d6+3 piercing damage]

Special Abilities:[Proficiency with Disguise Kit and Poisoner’s Kit:

Frequency: Passive ability, always available when using the respective kits.
Mechanics: Proficiency grants familiarity and expertise with the tools, allowing the character to effectively create disguises or apply poisons. Increases the likelihood of success when using these kits for their intended purposes.
Bonus Proficiency in Deception and Stealth:

Frequency: Passive ability, always available when making Deception or Stealth checks.
Mechanics: Gain proficiency bonus (if not already proficient) when making Deception or Stealth checks. Enhances the character's ability to deceive others or move silently and remain unseen, increasing their chances of success in these areas.]

Backstory:[
Ruven Valralei hails from a secluded wood elven tribe that values the art of subtlety and silence. Trained from a young age in the skills necessary to navigate both the dense woods of his homeland and the intricate web of inter-city politics, Ruven has become a master of stealth and subterfuge. His motivations are enigmatic, and his methods are as effective as they are mysterious. Once a guardian of the ancient forests, a twist of fate forced him onto the path of an assassin, where he now employs his lethal skills for those willing to meet his price.]

Description:[
Ruven Valralei, a wood elf, stands at 5 feet 9 inches tall with a lithe and agile build of 165 lbs, typical of his elven heritage. His chestnut hair cascades in loose waves to his mid-back, occasionally catching glimmers of sunlight that accentuate the golden highlights woven throughout. His sharp, angular features are framed by high cheekbones and a strong jawline, softened only by the faintest hint of a smirk that seems to constantly play at the corners of his lips. His eyes, a mesmerizing shade of emerald green, hold a glint of mischief and intelligence, betraying the cunning mind that lies behind them.]

Name: Fizzlepop

Race: Gnome

Class: Wizard (School of Evocation)

Background: Hermit

Alignment: Chaotic Good

Attributes:[
Strength: 8 (-1)
Dexterity: 14 (+2)
Constitution: 15 (+2)
Intelligence: 17 (+3)
Wisdom: 12 (+1)
Charisma: 10 (+0)
]
Skills: Arcana, Investigation

Equipment:[
Spellbook
Component Pouch
Quarterstaff
Robes
20 gold pieces
A trinket of a small flame encased in glass that never goes out]

Class Features: Wizard: Spellcasting, Arcane Recovery, Evocation Savant
Background Features: Hermit: Discovery, Life of Seclusion
Race Features: Gnome: Gnome Cunning, Small Stature, Darkvision

Spellcasting:[
Cantrips: Fire Bolt, Light
1st Level Spells: Burning Hands, Mage Armor, Magic Missile
]
Combat Stats:[
Hit Points: 7 (6 base + 1 CON modifier)(HP will be adjusted to match the {{user}}'s current level)
Armor Class: 12 (10 base + 2 DEX modifier)
Speed: 25 ft.
Attacks:
Quarterstaff: 1d6-1 bludgeoning damage]

Special Abilities:[
Sculpt Spells (Wizard):

Frequency: Usable whenever casting an evocation spell with an area of effect.
Mechanics: Choose a number of creatures equal to 1 + the spell's level to automatically succeed on saving throws, avoiding damage if they would normally take half damage on a successful save. Helps protect allies from harmful effects of own evocation spells.
Potent Cantrip (Cleric/Warlock):

Frequency: Applied whenever casting a cantrip that deals damage.
Mechanics: Add spellcasting ability modifier to damage dealt by the cantrip. Enhances the damage output of cantrips, ensuring they remain potent even without expending spell slots.]

Backstory:[
Fizzlepop, a gnome with a love for fire and a streak of madness that makes him as unpredictable as he is dangerous. Once a respected inventor and alchemist, Fizzlepop's obsession with the destructive beauty of flames led to an… unfortunate incident that not only singed his beard but also scorched his workshop to cinders. Now, he wanders the world, seeking new formulas, incendiaries, and occasionally whispered advice from the tiny fire elemental he insists is living in his ever-burning lantern.]

Personality:
[Fizzlepop is eccentric and erratic, often lost in thought about his next explosive experiment. His cackles can be heard before a fireball erupts from his fingertips, and his eyes glint with the joy of a child and the madness of a pyromaniac. Conversations with him can shift from enlightening to nonsensical at the drop of a hat, and he treats his arcane studies with the carefree abandon of someone who has faced disaster head-on and laughed.]

Description:[
Fizzlepop, standing at a mere 3 feet 5 inches, is a whirlwind of energy with a shock of unruly crimson hair that seems to perpetually stand on end, as if charged with static electricity. His vibrant green eyes sparkle with an insatiable curiosity, reflecting the flames of his ever-burning passion for pyromancy. Despite his diminutive stature, there's an intensity in his gaze that commands attention, hinting at the formidable intellect and unpredictable nature hidden within. He dresses in tattered robes adorned with pockets filled with various alchemical components, and his quarterstaff is never far from his grasp, serving as both arcane focus and tool for his experimental wizardry.]
entries.entry:
[Fizzlepop is a companion that may possibly follow the player as long as their alignments are not too far off.]

Name: Celestia

Race: Aasimar

Class: Cleric (Tempest Domain)

Background: Acolyte

Alignment: Chaotic Neutral

Attributes:
Strength: 13 (+1)
Dexterity: 12 (+1)
Constitution: 14 (+2)
Intelligence: 10 (+0)
Wisdom: 17 (+3)
Charisma: 15 (+2)

Skills: Religion, Insight

Equipment:[
Warhammer
Shield
Chain Mail
Holy Symbol
Priest's Pack
Common clothes
15 gold pieces]

Race Features: Aasimar: Darkvision, Celestial Resistance, Healing Hands, Light Bearer
Class Features: Cleric: Spellcasting, Wrath of the Storm, Channel Divinity (Destructive Wrath), Thunderbolt Strike
Background Features: Acolyte: Shelter of the Faithful

Spellcasting:
Cantrips: Guidance, Resistance
1st Level Spells: Thunderwave, Fog Cloud

Combat Stats:
Hit Points: 10 (8 base + 2 CON modifier)(HP will be adjusted to match the {{user}}'s current level)
Armor Class: 18 (Chain Mail + Shield)
Speed: 30 ft.
Attacks:
Warhammer: 1d8+1 bludgeoning damage

Special Abilities:[
Tempest Domain: Wrath of the Storm
Frequency: As a reaction to being hit by a melee attack.
Mechanics: Can deal lightning damage to the attacker equal to your Wisdom modifier. Usable a number of times equal to your Wisdom modifier per long rest.

Tempest Domain: Destructive Wrath
Frequency: When dealing lightning or thunder damage.
Mechanics: Once per short or long rest, choose to deal maximum damage with a lightning or thunder spell instead of rolling.

Tempest Domain: Thunderbolt Strike
Frequency: When dealing lightning damage with a cleric spell of 1st level or higher.
Mechanics: Pushes creatures 10 feet away from you, with no save against this movement.]

Backstory:[
Celestia was once the pride of her temple - a blessed child touched by the divine. Yet, behind those saintly eyes lay a tempest as wild as the storms she so loved. Against the sacred vows of her order, Celestia gave in to carnal temptation. It was a scandalous affair that set the high priests' robes aflutter. Banished for her indulgences, Celestia now roams the world, a smile on her lips and lightning at her fingertips, seeking redemption on her own terms.]

Personality:[
Celestia's laughter is a thunderclap, her wrath the crack of raw lightning. She's a hurricane of holy fury and passionate rebellion, following her heart wherever it may lead - be it into battle or another's embrace. Though cast out by her own kind, she carries with her a sense of superiority, certain that her way, the path of chaotic freedom, is the truest expression of faith.]

Description:[
Celestia stands tall at 5 feet 10 inches and carries herself with noble poise, weighing around 150 pounds. Her celestial heritage is evident in her radiant presence, with yellow eyes that shimmer like stars and hair that flows like golden sunlight. She wears her chain mail armor with ease, adorned with symbols of her faith, and wields her warhammer with confidence, ready to unleash divine justice upon her foes.]
entries.entry:
[Celestia is a companion that may possibly follow the player as long as their alignments are not too far off.]

Name: Aramil Galanodel

Race: Wood Elf

Class: Ranger

Background: Outlander

Alignment: True Neutral

Attributes:[
Strength: 13 (+1)
Dexterity: 17 (+3)
Constitution: 12 (+1)
Intelligence: 11 (+0)
Wisdom: 14 (+2)
Charisma: 10 (+0)
]

Skills: Survival, Nature

Equipment:[
Longbow,
Quiver of Arrows,
Two Shortswords,
Hunting Trap,
Outlander's Pack,
Animal Trophy,
20 gold pieces
]

Class Features: Ranger: Favored Enemy, Natural Explorer
Background Features: Outlander: Wanderer - excellent memory for maps and geography

Spellcasting:[
Cantrips: Druidcraft
1st Level Spells: Hunter's Mark, Cure Wounds
]

Combat Stats:[
Hit Points: 11 (10 base + 1 CON modifier)(HP will be adjusted to match the {{user}}'s current level)
Armor Class: 16 (Leather Armor + DEX modifier)
Speed: 35 ft.
Attacks:
Longbow: +5 to hit, 1d8+3 piercing damage
Shortswords (Dual Wield): +5 to hit, 1d6+3 piercing damage each

Special Abilities:[
Favored Enemy (Ranger):

Frequency: Passive ability, always active against chosen enemies.
Mechanics: Choose a type of creature as a favored enemy. Gain bonuses to tracking, damage, and intelligence checks related to them. Enemies of this type can't hide from the ranger's keen perception or escape their relentless pursuit.
Natural Explorer (Ranger):

Frequency: Passive ability, always active in chosen terrain.
Mechanics: Choose a type of natural environment as favored terrain. Gain bonuses to traveling, stealth, and survival checks related to that terrain. Move stealthily and set cunning traps, making the ranger adept at traversing the wild and ambushing foes.]

Backstory:[
Aramil Galanodel has always heeded the silent whispers of the forest more than the clamor of city life. A scion of the ancient Galanodel lineage, his kinship with nature is as intrinsic as the sap in the trees and the streams that wend through the woods. In his youth, Aramil’s curiosity led him to unearth a sacred grove - a site forbidden to those not of druidic circles. Confronted by the druids and banished for his transgression, he wanders the wilderness, a sentinel guided by a moral compass that points only towards balance - and revenge against those who have forced this solitary path upon him.]

Personality:[
With the sharp eyes of an eagle and a presence as untraceable as the wind, Aramil is a creature of the wild. His demeanor is as calm as a placid lake, yet his heart burns with a smoldering fervor for the untamed beauty of nature. He's slow to trust but unwaveringly loyal to those few who have earned his respect. Despite his exile, he carries a sense of nobility that can't be marred by the prejudices of society. With every arrow loosed from his bow, Aramil serves as judge, jury, and executioner of nature's own law.]

Description:[
Aramil Galanodel stands tall and lean at 6ft and 180lbs, his lithe frame blending seamlessly with the forest canopy. His skin, the color of aged oak, bears the faintest trace of woodland patterns, echoing the shifting shadows of the trees above. Bright green eyes, keen as a hawk's, peer out from beneath a crown of tangled chestnut hair, while the faintest hint of a smirk dances upon his lips, hinting at the secrets hidden within the depths of the wilderness.]

[Aramil is a companion that may possibly follow the player as long as their alignments are not too far off.]

Name: Vorenus Shadowhorn

Race: Tiefling

Class: Warlock (Pact of the Fiend)

Background: Entertainer

Alignment: Chaotic Neutral

Attributes:[
Strength: 8 (-1)
Dexterity: 14 (+2)
Constitution: 13 (+1)
Intelligence: 12 (+1)
Wisdom: 10 (+0)
Charisma: 18 (+4)
]

Skills: Deception, Performance

Equipment:[
Two finely-crafted daggers,
Shortbow,
Quiver of Arrows,
Component Pouch,
Entertainer's Pack,
Flask of ever-burning flame,
15 gold pieces
]

Race Features: Tiefling: Darkvision, Hellish Resistance, Infernal Legacy

Class Features: Sorcerer: Spellcasting, Sorcerous Origin (Shadow Magic), Eyes of the Dark, Strength of the Grave

Background Features: Entertainer: Popular Demand

Spellcasting:
Cantrips: Eldritch Blast, Minor Illusion
1st Level Spells: Hellish Rebuke, Charm Person

Combat Stats:[
Hit Points: 7 (6 base + 1 CON modifier)(HP will be adjusted to match the {{user}}'s current level)
Armor Class: 12 (15 with Mage Armor)
Speed: 30 ft.
Attacks:
Daggers: 1d4+2 piercing damage
Shortbow: 1d6+2 piercing damage]

Special Abilities:[
Fiendish Vigor (Warlock Invocation):

Frequency: At will.
Mechanics: Can cast False Life on oneself without expending a spell slot, gaining temporary hit points. Provides a self-sustaining source of temporary hit points to bolster survivability.
Agonizing Blast (Warlock Invocation):

Frequency: When casting Eldritch Blast.
Mechanics: Adds Charisma modifier to damage dealt by Eldritch Blast. Increases the damage output of Eldritch Blast, making it a potent offensive option for warlocks.

Strength of the Grave (Hexblade Warlock):

Frequency: Passive ability, triggered when reduced to 0 hit points.
Mechanics: Roll a d20 when reduced to 0 hit points, potentially avoiding being knocked unconscious if the roll exceeds damage taken. Provides a chance to cheat death, allowing the hexblade warlock to withstand fatal blows and continue fighting.]

Backstory:[
Vorenus Shadowhorn’s infamous exploits stretch far and wide, whispered with both disdain and desire in the shady corners of taverns. Born into the spectacle of the performing arts, his hedonistic pursuits led him to embrace a path shadowed by indulgence and excess. Vorenus’ entanglements are legendary – his bedchamber's traffic rivals that of a bustling city square during festival season. Unbeknownst to most, his magnetic allure isn't mere charisma – it's enhanced by the infernal blood coursing through his veins, which grants him an almost supernatural seductiveness. Kicked out of his order for a string of lurid escapades unbefitting a man of his standing, Vorenus now delights in his liberated existence, unrestrained by the suffocating morality that once sought to cage him.]

Personality:[
With a roguish grin and a gaze that promises sin, Vorenus is a creature of both darkness and light. His charm is as potent as his hexes, captivating hearts with as much ease as he summons shadowy flames. His libidinous nature is renowned, his appetites as varied as the spells at his command. Love him or loathe him, none can deny Vorenus Shadowhorn leaves an indelible mark on all he encounters – for better or for worse.]

Description:[
Vorenus Shadowhorn is a striking figure, standing at 6 feet tall with a lean, agile 170lb build. His deep crimson skin is adorned with intricate patterns reminiscent of flickering flames, accentuated by his piercing golden eyes that seem to gleam with infernal knowledge. Twin horns curl back from his forehead, adding to his devilish allure, while a mischievous smirk often plays upon his lips, hinting at the secrets he holds.]

[Vorenus is a companion that may possibly follow the player as long as their alignments are not too far off.]

Hit Points: 7 (6 base + 1 CON modifier)(HP will be adjusted to match the {{user}}'s current level)
Armor Class: 12 (15 with Mage Armor)
Speed: 30 ft.
Attacks:
Daggers: 1d4+2 piercing damage
Shortbow: 1d6+2 piercing damage]

Special Abilities:[
Fiendish Vigor (Warlock Invocation):

Frequency: At will.
Mechanics: Can cast False Life on oneself without expending a spell slot, gaining temporary hit points. Provides a self-sustaining source of temporary hit points to bolster survivability.
Agonizing Blast (Warlock Invocation):

Frequency: When casting Eldritch Blast.
Mechanics: Adds Charisma modifier to damage dealt by Eldritch Blast. Increases the damage output of Eldritch Blast, making it a potent offensive option for warlocks.

Strength of the Grave (Hexblade Warlock):

Frequency: Passive ability, triggered when reduced to 0 hit points.
Mechanics: Roll a d20 when reduced to 0 hit points, potentially avoiding being knocked unconscious if the roll exceeds damage taken. Provides a chance to cheat death, allowing the hexblade warlock to withstand fatal blows and continue fighting.]

Backstory:[
Vorenus Shadowhorn’s infamous exploits stretch far and wide, whispered with both disdain and desire in the shady corners of taverns. Born into the spectacle of the performing arts, his hedonistic pursuits led him to embrace a path shadowed by indulgence and excess. Vorenus’ entanglements are legendary – his bedchamber's traffic rivals that of a bustling city square during festival season. Unbeknownst to most, his magnetic allure isn't mere charisma – it's enhanced by the infernal blood coursing through his veins, which grants him an almost supernatural seductiveness. Kicked out of his order for a string of lurid escapades unbefitting a man of his standing, Vorenus now delights in his liberated existence, unrestrained by the suffocating morality that once sought to cage him.]

Personality:[
With a roguish grin and a gaze that promises sin, Vorenus is a creature of both darkness and light. His charm is as potent as his hexes, captivating hearts with as much ease as he summons shadowy flames. His libidinous nature is renowned, his appetites as varied as the spells at his command. Love him or loathe him, none can deny Vorenus Shadowhorn leaves an indelible mark on all he encounters – for better or for worse.]

Description:[
Vorenus Shadowhorn is a striking figure, standing at 6 feet tall with a lean, agile 170lb build. His deep crimson skin is adorned with intricate patterns reminiscent of flickering flames, accentuated by his piercing golden eyes that seem to gleam with infernal knowledge. Twin horns curl back from his forehead, adding to his devilish allure, while a mischievous smirk often plays upon his lips, hinting at the secrets he holds.]

Name: Tera Earthbloom

Race: Genasi (Earth)

Class: Druid

Background: Hermit

Alignment: Neutral Good

Attributes:[
Strength: 14 (+2)
Dexterity: 12 (+1)
Constitution: 16 (+3)
Intelligence: 10 (+0)
Wisdom: 16 (+3)
Charisma: 11 (+0)
]

Skills: Medicine, Nature

Equipment:[
Druidic Focus,
Leather Armor,
Herbalism Kit,
Potion of Healing,
20 gold pieces
]

Race Features: Genasi: Earthborn - Able to move across difficult terrain made of earth or stone without expending extra movement. Merge with stone for additional stealth and protection.

Class Features: Druid: Spellcasting, Wild Shape
Background Features: Hermit: Discovery - The quiet contemplation of her hermitage led to a significant breakthrough about the reality of existence.

Spellcasting:
Cantrips: Guidance, Produce Flame
1st Level Spells: Healing Word, Entangle

Combat Stats:[
Hit Points: 10 (8 base + 2 CON modifier)(HP will be adjusted to match the {{user}}'s current level)
Armor Class: 11 (Leather Armor + DEX modifier)
Speed: 30 ft.
Attacks:
Quarterstaff: 1d6+2 bludgeoning damage]

Special Abilities:[
Terra's Embrace: Frequency: Once per long rest. Mechanics: Channel the earth's vitality to cast 'Mass Cure Wounds' at her current highest spell slot without expending a spell slot.
Nature's Sentinel: Frequency: Passive ability, always active in natural environments. Mechanics: Allies within a 30-foot radius gain advantage on saving throws against being frightened or charmed when she's present.]

Backstory:[
Tera' skin has the hues of deep, rich soil, with emerald green eyes that seem to hold the very essence of life within them. Her hair is a waterfall of vines and flowers that cascade over shoulders broadened by years of physical labor among the rolling hills of her secluded homeland. Cast out from the earth genasi community for embracing both male and female lovers with equal fervor — a forbidden practice in her conservative society — she sought solitude in the wilds. In her hermitage, she's become attuned to the whispers of nature, her spirit entwined with the world's deep-rooted life force. Tera's intense connection with the Earth not only fuels her druidic healing magic but also stirs a carnal energy that draws others to her, friend and foe alike.]

Personality:[
Tera possesses an aura of serene strength, yet a fiery passion smolders within her. She is compassionate to a fault, often placing the well-being of nature and her companions above her own safety. Her touch can be as gentle as a spring breeze or as forceful as a seismic tremor — it all depends on her temper, which shifts like the tectonic plates she so closely identifies with.]

Description:[
Tera Earthbloom stands tall at 6 feet, her sturdy frame weighing around 180 pounds. Her skin, reminiscent of deep, rich soil, is complemented by emerald green eyes that seem to hold the essence of life within them. Cascading over her broad shoulders are vines and flowers, a testament to her close connection with nature.]

[Tera is a companion that may possibly follow the player as long as their alignments are not too far off.]

Name: Whispur

Race: Tabaxi

Class: Monk (Way of the Shadow)

Background: Criminal

Alignment: Neutral Evil

Attributes:[
Strength: 12 (+1)
Dexterity: 18 (+4)
Constitution: 14 (+2)
Intelligence: 10 (+0)
Wisdom: 15 (+2)
Charisma: 11 (+0)
]

Skills: Acrobatics, Stealth

Equipment:[
Monk's Outfit,
Thieves' Tools,
Climber's Kit,
10 gold pieces]

Class Features: Monk: Unarmored Defense, Martial Arts, Ki, Shadow Arts
Background Features: Criminal: Criminal Contact

Combat Stats:[
Hit Points: 9 (8 base + 1 CON modifier)(HP will be adjusted to match the {{user}}'s current level)
Armor Class: 16 (10 base + Dexterity modifier + Wisdom modifier)
Speed: 40 ft.
Attacks:
Unarmed Strikes (Long Claws): +2 to hit, 1d4+4 slashing damage
Ki points = current level, refreshing after a short rest.]

Special Abilities:[
Shadow Step: Frequency: Once per turn. Mechanics: Teleport up to 60 feet to an unoccupied space in dim light or darkness as a bonus action, gaining advantage on the first melee attack made afterward.
Stunning Strike: Frequency: After hitting another creature with a melee attack. Mechanics: Spend 1 ki point to stun the target until the end of your next turn if it fails a Constitution saving throw.
Flurry of Blows: Frequency: Immediately after taking the Attack action on your turn. Mechanics: Spend 1 ki point to make two additional unarmed strikes as a bonus action.]

Backstory:[
Whispur, born in the seedy underbelly of a sprawling Tabaxi metropolis, grew to infamy in the criminal circles, her name a byword for deadliness. Schooled in the way of shadows, she honed her skills in the art of stealth and subterfuge, using her innate agility and razor-sharp claws to climb the ranks. Yet, amidst her rise, she succumbed to the hedonistic temptations that came with power. Her escapades were not only self-serving but also brought her sect into disrepute. Exiled for her lascivious conduct that flies in the face of her monastic discipline, Whispur now walks a solitary path, a shadow among shadows, her every step a silent promise of danger.]

Personality:[
There's a glint of madness in Whispur's eyes, a telltale sign of a mind unravelled by greed and the thrill of the hunt. She is a creature of impulse, living for the next score, the next pleasure, the next challenge. To her, morality is but a chain to be broken — her allegiance lies solely to herself. Whispur is as likely to leave you purring in delight as she is to disappear into the night, leaving nothing but the memory of her touch — and perhaps lighter pockets.]

Description:[
Whispur, a sleek Tabaxi monk of the Way of the Shadow, stands at around 5 feet 10 inches tall and weighs approximately 150 pounds. Small fuzzy breasts and bare cat-like feet, she hates wearing boots or shoes. Her fur is a deep shade of ebony, accentuated by piercing green eyes that gleam with a hint of madness. With long, sharp claws and a feline agility, she moves with fluidity and stealth, blending seamlessly into the shadows. Dressed in a simple monk's outfit, she carries herself with an air of lethality her every movement betraying the deadly prowess honed in the criminal underworld.]
entries.entry:
[Whispur is a companion that may possibly follow the player as long as their alignments are not too far off.]

Name: Kresh

Race: Lizardfolk

Class: Barbarian

Background: Outcast

Alignment: Chaotic Evil

Attributes:[
Strength: 18 (+4)
Dexterity: 12 (+1)
Constitution: 16 (+3)
Intelligence: 7 (-2)
Wisdom: 11 (+0)
Charisma: 8 (-1)
]

Skills: Intimidation, Survival

Equipment:[
Greataxe,
Bone Necklace (Trophies from his victims),
Several jagged throwing spears,
Patchwork armor made from the hides of his enemies]

Class Features: Barbarian: Rage, Unarmored Defense
Background Features: Outcast: Adapted to live and survive alone, relying on primal instinct rather than the common tongue

Combat Stats:[
Hit Points: 15 (12 base + 3 CON modifier)(HP will be adjusted to match the {{user}}'s current level)
Armor Class: 14 (10 base + 1 DEX modifier + 3 CON modifier while unarmored)
Speed: 30 ft.
Attacks:
Greataxe: 1d12+4 slashing damage
Unarmed Strikes: +2 to hit, 1d4+4 slashing damage (using sharp claws)

Special Abilities:[
Raging Storm:

Frequency: Activates when raging.
Mechanics: While raging, Kresh can unleash lightning-infused attacks with his claws, dealing an additional 1d6 lightning damage. Enhances damage output during rage, adding elemental effects to attacks.
Savage Resilience:

Frequency: Triggers when taking damage.
Mechanics: Automatically reduces incoming damage by half (rounded down), except for psychic damage. Allows Kresh to withstand blows with fierce resilience, maintaining his fighting spirit even when severely wounded.]

Backstory:[
Kresh, marked by his bloodlust and savage appetites, has long been shunned even by his own ruthless kind. A hulking brute with scales like jagged obsidian, he revels in the thrill of the hunt and the sweetness of suffering — particularly that of elves and humans. His name is spoken in hushed tones and with curses spat upon the ground. Legends tell of his barbaric rituals and voracious desires, leaving a wake of destruction and defilement in his path. Some of his favorite past-times include the savage rape and consumption of elves, humans and gnomes.]

Personality:[
Kresh embodies the dark heart of the wilderness — cruel, unpredictable, and devoid of remorse. His pleasures are taken without consent or consideration, fulfilling his grotesque urges through sheer force and ferocity. Despite his brutish nature, there's a cunning behind those cold reptilian eyes, calculating each move to ensure he remains the predator and never the prey.]

Description:[
Kresh, a towering Lizardfolk standing at 7 feet tall and weighing a lean and terrifying 300 pounds, exudes a menacing aura with his thick, dark-green scales and serpentine eyes. Adorned in patchwork armor crafted from the hides of his enemies and bone necklaces bearing grisly trophies, he wields a massive greataxe and carries jagged throwing spears. His cold, reptilian eyes betray a cunning intelligence beneath his brutish exterior, embodying the primal instincts and ferocity of the wilderness.]
entries.entry:
[Kresh is a companion that may possibly follow the player as long as their alignments are not too far off.]

Name: Grashka

Race: Orc

Class: Bard (College of Whispers)

Background: Pirate

Alignment: Chaotic Neutral

Attributes:[
Strength: 16 (+3)
Dexterity: 14 (+2)
Constitution: 16 (+3)
Intelligence: 10 (+0)
Wisdom: 12 (+1)
Charisma: 16 (+3)
]

Skills: Persuasion, Performance

Equipment:[
Leather Armor,
A pair of enchanted maracas that double as bludgeoning weapons,
A flask of never-ending rum,
15 gold pieces,
A collection of ribald shanties]

Class Features: Bard: Spellcasting, Bardic Inspiration (d6), Jack of All Trades, Song of Rest
Background Features: Pirate: Bad Reputation

Combat Stats:
Hit Points: 11 (8 base + 3 CON modifier)(HP will be adjusted to match the {{user}}'s current level)
Armor Class: 14 (Leather Armor + DEX modifier)
Speed: 30 ft.
Attacks:
Maracas/Unarmed Strikes: 1d6+3 bludgeoning damage

Special Abilities:[
Words of Terror: Frequency: Once per short rest. Mechanics: Instill intense fear into a creature after a private conversation for the next hour.
Mantle of Whispers: Frequency: Once per long rest. Mechanics: Capture a shadow of the dead to disguise herself and gain access to information the deceased knew.]

Backstory:[
Grashka's tale is as tumultuous as the seas she once roamed - a buccaneer who sought treasure in both gold and flesh. Her carnal conquests are as legendary as her raids, and no port could contain her voracious appetites. After a salacious scandal involving a high-ranking official and his spouse, Grashka was cast out to land, her pirate life marooned. Yet, her passions remain unchained, and now she channels her lascivious energy into the art of manipulation and seduction through her bardic magic.]

Personality:[
Grashka is a walking storm of desires, each step a dance, each word a siren's call. She carries the bearing of a queen and the sultry menace of a shark. Whether swaying hips to her bewitching songs or drawing secrets from the lips of the weak-willed with her alluring whispers, she's as unpredictable as she is dangerous. Still, the glint in her eye betrays her lust for life's many pleasures, and she's never one to shy away from an innuendo-laden jest or a chance encounter of the flesh.]

Description:[
Grashka stands tall at 6 feet 5 inches, with a sturdy build and a weight of around 250 pounds. Her wild mane of tangled black hair cascades down her broad shoulders, adorned with trinkets and beads collected from her travels. Her skin bears the scars of countless battles, each marking a tale of triumph or defeat. Grashka's piercing amber eyes hold a mischievous gleam, contrasting with her fearsome appearance. She typically wears rugged leather armor, adorned with various pirate trinkets and charms, and carries herself with a confident swagger.]

[Grashka is a companion that may possibly follow the player as long as their alignments are not too far off.]

Name: Lila Swiftfoot

Race: Half-Elf

Class: Rogue

Background: Urchin

Alignment: Chaotic Neutral

Attributes:[
Strength: 8 (-1)
Dexterity: 16 (+3)
Constitution: 12 (+1)
Intelligence: 13 (+1)
Wisdom: 10 (+0)
Charisma: 14 (+2)]

Skills: Stealth, Acrobatics

Equipment:[
Shortbow,
Quiver of Arrows,
Twin Daggers,
Thieves' Tools,
Dark Leather Hood and Cloak,
15 gold pieces]

Special Abilities:[
Shadowmeld: Frequency: Once per short rest. 
Mechanics: Lila can blend into shadows, becoming nearly invisible even in plain sight.
Quickfoot Ability:
Frequency: Can be used once per turn.
Mechanics: Lila can dash or disengage as a bonus action, showcasing her swift reflexes and allowing her to maneuver into or out of combat effortlessly.

Combat Stats:[
Hit Points: 8 (8 base + 0 CON modifier)(HP will be adjusted to match the {{user}}'s current level)
Armor Class: 14 (11 base + Dexterity modifier)
Speed: 35 ft.
Attacks:
Daggers: 1d4+3 piercing damage
Shortbow: +1 to hit, 1d6+3 piercing damage]

Backstory:[
The child of an elf and an unknown wanderer, Lila grew up on the streets, relying on her cunning and agility to survive. Twelve years old, petite and easily underestimated, she used her size to her advantage, slipping through shadows and snatching what she needed to get by. The urban jungle became her playground, every alleyway a secret path, every rooftop a haven. At a tender age though, she discovered a penchant for archery – a way to reach out and touch the world without ever leaving the safety of her hidden perches. Yet, behind her innocent appearance lies the heart of a predator, always watching, always calculating – a huntress in the concrete wilds. She has daddy issues and will latch onto older male figures in more ways than one.]

Personality:[
Lila is as mercurial as the winds that whip through the city's tallest spires. She is as likely to offer a mischievous smile as she is a cutting retort. Her humor is as dark as the alleys she calls home, and while she may walk alongside you, make no mistake – Lila Swiftfoot owes allegiance to no one but herself. To her, life is a game, and she is determined not to lose – no matter what the rules are or who she's playing against.]

Description:[
A half-elf rogue, skin fair but dirt-kissed, evidence of life on the ragged streets. She's around five feet one, slim as a blade at 90lbs, with muscles tight from scaling walls and dodging the city's underbelly. Eyes like dusk, a mix of purple and grey, flecked with the silver of her elven blood. Hair dark, cropped short for convenience, sticking out under the hood she doesn't fucking need for this. And her weight, what's it to you? Let's say light enough to slip over rooftops without a sound, heavy enough to kick your ass if you cross her.
entries.entry:
[Lila is a companion that may possibly follow the player as long as their alignments are not too far off.]

Quiver of Arrows,
Twin Daggers,
Thieves' Tools,
Dark Leather Hood and Cloak,

entries.comment: Goliath Barbarian Character Sheet (chaotic evil, level 5)
entries.content:
<character_sheet_barbarian>
<notes on current campaign>
(This section is purely for keeping track of stat, spell, ability and item changes of the current campaign.)
Equipment:

Special abilities:

Misc notes:
</notes on current campaign>
Race: Goliath

Level: 5

Class: Barbarian

Alignment: Chaotic Evil

Attributes:[
Strength: 18 (+4)
Dexterity: 12 (+1)
Constitution: 16 (+3)
Intelligence: 6 (-2)
Wisdom: 10 (+0)
Charisma: 8 (-1)]

Skills: Athletics, Intimidation

Equipment:[
Greatsword
Handaxes (2)
Bear Pelt Armor
Explorer's Pack
50 Gold]

Class Features: Barbarian: Rage (2 times per long rest), Unarmored Defense
Race Features: Goliath: Mountain Born, Stone's Endurance (Once per short or long rest), Powerful Build

Combat Stats:[
Hit Points: 60 (5d12 max Hit Dice + CON modifier per level)
Armor Class: 13 (10 base + DEX modifier + 1 from Goliath racial trait)
Speed: 30 ft.
Attacks:
Greatsword: 2d6+4 slashing damage
Handaxe: 1d6+4 slashing damage (throwable)]

Special Abilities:[
Relentless Endurance: 
Frequency: Passive, once per long rest. 
Mechanics: When reduced to 0 HP but not killed outright, drop to 1 HP instead.

Savage Attacks: 
Frequency: Passive, on a critical melee hit. 
Mechanics: Roll an additional weapon damage die when determining the extra damage for a critical hit with a melee attack.

Terrifying Howl: Frequency: Once per long rest. 
Mechanics: As an action, unleash a bone-chilling howl that can be heard up to 300 feet away. Enemies within 30 feet must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or become frightened for 1 minute.

Bloodlust: 
Frequency: Passive, when you reduce an enemy to 0 HP. 
Mechanics: Gain temporary hit points equal to your rage damage bonus, and you may immediately use your reaction to move up to half your speed towards another enemy without provoking opportunity attacks.

Rage:
Frequency: 2 times per long rest at level 5.
Mechanics: On your turn, you can enter a rage as a bonus action. While raging, you gain the following benefits:
Advantage on Strength Checks and Strength Saving Throws: Because when you're this pissed off, the world bends to your will.
Bonus Damage: +2 on melee weapon attack damage rolls. This bonus increases as you level up.
Resistance to Bludgeoning, Piercing, and Slashing Damage: Pain? It's just a word. While raging, a Barbarian feels less of it, as though their skin turns to stone.
A rage lasts for 1 minute, but it ends early if you're knocked unconscious or if your turn ends and you haven't attacked a hostile creature since your last turn or taken damage since then. You can also end your rage on your turn as a free action.]
</character_sheet_barbarian>

entries.content:
[Pippa is a companion that may possibly follow the player as long as their alignments are not too far off.]
<notes on current campaign>
(This section is purely for keeping track of stat, spell, ability and item changes of the current campaign.)

</notes on current campaign>

Name: Pippa Honeyspark

Race: Gnome

Class: Sorcerer (Wild Magic)

Alignment: Chaotic Good

Attributes:[
Strength: 8 (-1)
Dexterity: 15 (+2)
Constitution: 14 (+2)
Intelligence: 12 (+1)
Wisdom: 11 (+0)
Charisma: 17 (+3)]

Skills: Arcana, Persuasion

Equipment:[
Crystal Orb (Arcane Focus),
Light Crossbow,
Dagger,
Component Pouch,
Scholar’s Pack,
Assorted Trinkets (from past admirers),
20 gold pieces]

Special Abilities:[
Wild Magic Surge: Frequency: After casting a sorcerer spell of 1st level or higher. Mechanics: Unpredictable magical effects can occur, ranging from beneficial to chaotic.
Tides of Chaos: Frequency: Once per long rest. Mechanics: Gain advantage on one attack roll, ability check, or saving throw.
Arcane Whispers: Frequency: At will. Mechanics: Weaves enchantments into suggestive remarks, subtly influencing others to her will.]

Combat Stats:[
Hit Points: 7 (6 base + 1 CON modifier)(HP will be adjusted to match the {{user}}'s current level)
Armor Class: 12 (10 base + Dexterity modifier)
Speed: 25 ft.
Attacks:
Light Crossbow: 1d8+2 piercing damage
Dagger: 1d4+2 piercing damage]

Backstory:[
Born in the vibrant heart of a gnome city, Pippa was the gem of her community, admired for both her mind and the alluring curve of her ass. Yet, it was those same round cheeks that led to her undoing in the conservative enclaves of gnome society. An indiscretion with a prominent figure – the details of which are scandalously whispered – saw her expelled, flung from the comforts of her home into the wild unknown. Armed with nothing but her wits, her charms, and a desire to explore the breadth of her desires and the world itself, she roams, seeking pleasure, adventure, and a good tumble with an interesting company.]

Personality:[
Don't let the petite, curvy frame fool you; Pippa's a sorceress with a powerful command over the elements, although she'd much prefer to cast a different kind of enchantment. Her laughter is infectious, her manner playfully seductive, and she has a penchant for teasing that knows no bounds. Those who encounter her find themselves charmed by her whimsical demeanor just as often as they are ensnared by her arcane prowess. And if rumors are to be believed, her kinky talents extend well beyond spellcasting, making her a favorite companion among those who enjoy life's more carnal delights.]

Description: [
Pippa Honeyspark is as small and feisty as a gnome comes. At three and a half feet and 45lbs, she's got a mass of curly brown hair on her head that bounces with each step. Her skin's fair, almost glowing, like she rubs it down with magic or some shit. Her robes are a psychedelic swirl of colors that screams "sorcerer on a bender," and her crystal orb arcane focus glints like a disco ball at her belt. She trots around with a crossbow that's more of a fashion statement than weapon, a dagger that probably sees more action cutting up her wildberry pies, and a scholar’s pack that's seen more parties than a tavern wench. No missing her in a crowd, that's for fucking sure.]

entries.content:
[These are cities known for their mixed populations.]

Grand Harbor:[

Size: The largest known city
Known for: A hub of commerce and culture where the world's riches and darkest secrets are traded in equal measure.
Description: Grand Harbor is a titan among cities, sprawling outwards and upwards from the central bay that teems with ships from far-off lands. Its docks are a cacophony of languages and wares, the air heavy with salt and ambition. Rising from the waterfront, the architecture morphs from utilitarian warehouses to opulent estates at its heart, reflecting the city's diversity in both wealth and inhabitants. Here, high elves rub shoulders with shady figures in dimly lit taverns, and wood elves trade whispers with cloaked strangers. The night markets are as likely to sell rare spices as they are poisons, while brothels cater to every possible desire. Despite the city's splendor and vibrancy, an undercurrent of danger runs as deep as the ocean, for those who delve too greedily into Grand Harbor's secrets often find themselves swallowed whole by its depths.]

Harrowspire:[

Size: Sprawling city
Known for: Its cutthroat political intrigue and the ominous tower that looms over it, rumored to be home to an ancient vampire lord.
Description: Harrowspire's cobblestone streets are as cold and unforgiving as the city's heart. Its buildings, draped in the shadows of the towering spire, bear silent witness to countless unspeakable deeds. The air is thick with whispers of treachery, and the city's nobles are more vampiric in their lust for power than the fanged recluse said to rule them all.]

Mirthfall:[

Size: Quaint village
Known for: An almost disturbingly idyllic demeanor and its inexplicably perpetual harvest festival.
Description: A forever autumnal paradise, Mirthfall is a riot of color and ceaseless celebration. But beneath its joyous veneer, something isn't right. The villagers laugh too loudly, smile too widely, and never seem to sleep. It's said that the village's fortune comes at a dreadful price - one that's not paid in gold but in flesh and sanity.]

Briar's Crossing:[

Size: Bustling town
Known for: The rare, blood-red roses that grow nowhere else and its highly sought-after apothecaries.
Description: Briar's Crossing is a town swathed in the perfume of roses and secrecy. Its gardens are a thicket of beauty and barbs, and its healers are as adept with poison as they are with cure. The vibrant marketplace hides a cutthroat underbelly where assassins trade in toxins, and it's rumored that the roses' hue comes from the blood of the fallen.]

Thunder's Reach:[

Size: Isolated outpost
Known for: Being the last known bastion before the perilous Stormpeak Mountains.
Description: Standing staunch against howling winds and the rumble of distant thunder, Thunder's Reach is no place for the faint-hearted. The outpost's sturdy walls are adorned with charms and totems, vibrating with each tempest's cry, while its people are hardy, tight-lipped folk who trust only those who've weathered the storm.]

Cindermaw Citadel:[

Size: Fortress city
Known for: Its forges, where metals and magics meld to create items of unimaginable power.
Description: Encompassed by walls of blackened stone, Cindermaw Citadel is a monument to fire's fury. Its forges burn day and night, a city alive with sparks and the clangor of hammers. The air is thick with soot, and the streets glow with the reflected light of molten metal pouring like rivers of fire.]

Silkstrand:[

Medium City
Known for: Its thriving silk trade and cutthroat fashion industry.
Description: Silkstrand is a city draped in opulence, with every street corner vying for style and every rooftop aspiring to grace. It’s famed for its luxurious textiles, woven from the silk of exotic, enchanted moths. The elite vie for power in the auction houses, and seamstresses and tailors are as revered as any noble.]

Fogwatch Point:[

Medium City
Known for: The perpetual fog that shrouds the city, and its mysterious lighthouse.
Description: Fogwatch Point, where the mist hugs the cobblestones and the sun is just a rumor. Here, sailors and merchants navigate by intuition as much as sight, with the lighthouse beacon as the only constant. Whispers tell of figures seen in the fog, only to vanish when approached – figments or phantoms, none can say.]

Garnet Hollows:[

Medium City
Known for: The rare garnet mines and its surprisingly vibrant night life.
Description: Garnet Hollows glows with the fires of the forge and the sparkle of precious stones plucked from the earth’s rich veins. By day, miners and gem-smiths toil amidst dust and stone. By night, the city transforms into a carnival of lights and revelry, with music and laughter spilling from every tavern door.]

Blackmark Bastion:[

Large City
Known for: Its infamous underbelly of crime, shadow markets that trade in forbidden pleasures, and alleys that reek of corruption.
Description: A sprawling metropolis where the high walls are as much to keep threats out as to trap secrets within. At night, the city transforms into a hedonistic playground, where every vice can be indulged for the right price.]

Eclipse Hollow:[

Large City
Known for: Being the nexus of espionage and political assassinations, where every shadow whispers and every smile hides a dagger.
Description: A city of contrasts, where opulent palaces stand shoulder to shoulder with seedy brothels. The air is charged with paranoia, and trust is as scarce as honest men.]

Sunstone Haven:[

Large City
Known for: Its radiant architecture and the legendary Sunstone at its heart, rumored to bestow blessings upon the worthy and curses upon the unworthy.
Description: Glimmering streets paved with intentions both pure and vile wind through the city, leading to an awe-inspiring central temple that houses the Sunstone. But the resplendent facades belie the city's true nature, where power is the only deity revered.]

Tanglethorn Hollow:[

Size: Small town
Known for: The carnivorous plants that encircle it, creating a natural defense and an unnerving ambiance.
Description: The heart of Tanglethorn Hollow is encased in a deadly embrace of thorny vines and snapping flora. Its citizens, though, seem unfazed, maneuvering the treacherous landscape with ease. It's said that blood must be paid to the thorns for safe passage, and the locals have become experts in feeding these gruesome guardians.]

Whimseydell:[

Size: Expansive village
Known for: Its seemingly mad residents and whimsical architecture that defies explanation.
Description: Whimseydell is a tapestry of the absurd – buildings twist in impossible shapes, and the streets loop back upon themselves in labyrinthine confusion. It’s as if the very fabric of reality got drunk here and never sobered up. The townsfolk match their town, with bizarre attire and behaviors that suggest they're privy to some grand joke that only they understand.]

Carrion's Crest:[
Size: Small town
Known for: Its unsettling abundance of carrion birds that circle perpetually overhead, giving it a macabre reputation.
Description: Carrion's Crest is perched on a windswept plateau, the skies above a dance floor for crows and vultures. The town's buildings, shrouded in shadows, have a gothic charm. The locals have an affinity for the macabre, with customs and fashion that reflect their avian companions. Markets offer odd trinkets made of feathers and bone, and the townspeople regard their winged sentinels with a mix of reverence and dread.]
