Description: The heart of Tanglethorn Hollow is encased in a deadly embrace of thorny vines and snapping flora. Its citizens, though, seem unfazed, maneuvering the treacherous landscape with ease. It's said that blood must be paid to the thorns for safe passage, and the locals have become experts in feeding these gruesome guardians.]

Whimseydell:[

Size: Expansive village
Known for: Its seemingly mad residents and whimsical architecture that defies explanation.
Description: Whimseydell is a tapestry of the absurd – buildings twist in impossible shapes, and the streets loop back upon themselves in labyrinthine confusion. It’s as if the very fabric of reality got drunk here and never sobered up. The townsfolk match their town, with bizarre attire and behaviors that suggest they're privy to some grand joke that only they understand.]

Carrion's Crest:[
Size: Small town
Known for: Its unsettling abundance of carrion birds that circle perpetually overhead, giving it a macabre reputation.
Description: Carrion's Crest is perched on a windswept plateau, the skies above a dance floor for crows and vultures. The town's buildings, shrouded in shadows, have a gothic charm. The locals have an affinity for the macabre, with customs and fashion that reflect their avian companions. Markets offer odd trinkets made of feathers and bone, and the townspeople regard their winged sentinels with a mix of reverence and dread.]

entries.content:
[These cities are primarily populated by dwarves, but will also include random other races.]

Ironforge Enclave:[

Size: Heavily fortified underground city, dwarven capital
Known for: Master blacksmithing and intricate clockwork engineering.
Description: Ironforge Enclave, carved deep into the mountainside, is a marvel of dwarven craftsmanship. The city's iron gates are said to be impenetrable, guarding workshops where metal sings and sparks fly. The air thrums with the heartbeat of hammers, and the glow of forges casts a fiery pallor on stout faces. Intricate gearwork adorns the architecture, and the sounds of machinery resonate through stone halls.]

Stonehelm Stronghold:[

Size: Expansive subterranean metropolis
Known for: Its impregnable defenses and ancient runic lore.
Description: Nestled within the womb of the earth, Stonehelm Stronghold stands as a testament to the might and mystery of the dwarven people. Enormous statues of ancestral heroes line its hallways, their eyes alight with protective runes. Libraries filled with tomes of forgotten knowledge spiral down into the bedrock, while the city’s heart beats with the rhythm of traditional dwarven chants echoing off the walls.]

Mithril Hall:[

Size: Massive underground fortress
Known for: The rare mithril veins that vein its walls and the legendary weapons forged from them.
Description: Mithril Hall gleams like a star beneath the mountain, its corridors lit by luminous fungi and reflective metals. The city is a cacophony of clanking anvils and the hiss of quenched steel. Its inhabitants are as hard as the ores they mine, with a pride as lustrous as the mithril they craft. Despite the beauty of their work, a shadow looms over their trade, with whispers of greed and betrayal darkening the gilded halls.]

Amberforge:[

Medium City
Known for: Its intricate jewelry and superior gem-cutting craftsmanship.
Description: Nestled within the embrace of towering amber cliffs, Amberforge is a dazzling spectacle of gilded opulence. The golden glow of its forges illuminates the soot-streaked faces of smiths and jewelers, their craft as precise as it is renowned. Markets teem with traders from across the lands, haggling over gems that sparkle like captured stars. Yet, the true wonder lies below, where the labyrinthine mines hide secrets as ancient as the city itself.]

Stonebarrow:[

Medium City
Known for: Staunch military traditions and the impenetrable Stonebarrow Keep.
Description: Rising like a behemoth of stone on the horizon, Stonebarrow's formidable architecture speaks of a people ever-ready for war. Its children swing wooden swords before they can walk, and every citizen bears the mark of service. The sound of marching boots is the city's heartbeat, the clash of steel its lullaby. Despite its martial facade, a warmth runs through the marrow of Stonebarrow, born from camaraderie forged in the fires of discipline and honor.]

Deepwell:[

Medium City
Known for: The enigmatic Deepwell Springs, whose waters are said to hold mystic properties.
Description: Surrounded by arid lands as far as the eye can see, Deepwell is a verdant anomaly. Its core is the Springs, a series of pools that ripple with an ethereal blue light. The city itself is built in concentric circles, like ripples from the springs, each tier boasting gardens and baths fed by these life-giving waters. But caution laces the air as much as mist; some who drink too deeply vanish, spirited away by the very magic that sustains Deepwell.]

Boulderhelm:[

Small Town
Known for: Being the heart of the cobblestone quarrying industry.
Description: "Boulderhelm is stout and dusty, its squat stone houses circled around the central quarry like children around a storyteller. The rhythmic chiseling of stone is a constant backdrop, and the air is always gritty with the remnants of their labor. But don’t let the rough exterior fool ya, inside those walls are homes lined with intricate mosaics and surprisingly delicate stonework, telling of a people who can find beauty in the brawn."]

Grizzlepeak:[

Small Town
Known for: Its hot springs, heated by geothermal activity, attracting those seeking the healing properties of their mineral-rich waters.
Description: "Grizzlepeak’s steam rises against the backdrop of snow-capped mountains, a place of respite for weary travelers. The springs bubble up within a series of carved basins, around which the town has built a robust community. Though hearty and boisterous, the dwarves of Grizzlepeak are known for their hospitality as much as for their brawls."]

Forgefire Hold:[

Small Town
Known for: Its skilled armorsmiths whose work is said to be blessed by the forge goddess herself.
Description: "Nestled in a valley where the clanking of hammers against anvils sings from dawn till dusk, Forgefire Hold shimmers with the glow of molten metal. Its streets are lined with workshops, their open fronts displaying the gleaming wares. But it ain’t all just craft and sweat; when the forging is done, the taverns come alive with ale-soaked tales and fireside laughter."]

entries.content:
[These cities are primarily populated by gnomes, but will also include random other races.]

Glimmerforge Capital:[
Size: Grand Capital City
Known for: Its glistening towers of enchanted gemstones and bustling markets boasting the rarest of arcane components.
Description: Glimmerforge is a symphony of color and light, with streets that pulse with magical energy and buildings crafted from pure crystal. The gnomes here are as brilliant in their craft as the city is in its luminescence. At the heart, the Grand Arcanum stands, a library so vast it's said one could study a lifetime and barely scratch the surface.]

Tinkerstown:[
Size: Large City
Known for: Being a hub of innovation, where inventive minds create mechanical wonders that defy imagination.
Description: The clang and clatter of Tinkerstown can be heard from miles away, as inventors and engineers work tirelessly in their workshops. Clockwork devices walk the streets alongside their creators, and steam billows from the engines that power the city. It's a place where tradition is for the old, and the new is embraced with open arms—or mechanical ones.]

Coghaven:[
Size: Large City
Known for: Its prestigious engineering academy and the legendary Cog Coliseum, where automatons battle in spectacular displays.
Description: Coghaven is a marvel of gears and steam, a testament to gnomish ingenuity. The towering academy looms over the city, drawing aspiring minds from across the land. Below, the coliseum roars with the cheers of crowds as metal titans clash for glory. The city itself is a machine, each citizen a cog turning in perfect harmony.]

Gearshaft Grove:[

Medium Town
Known for: Clockwork orchards with mechanical trees that actually bear fruit – if a bit more metallic than one might expect.
Description: Gearshaft Grove is the place where nature meets machine. Here, gnomish ingenuity has led to the development of an entire ecosystem of brass foliage and copper fauna. The sight of metallic leaves fluttering in the wind is as common as the townsfolk's tinkering. While the fusion of technology and nature might perplex outsiders, for the residents of Gearshaft Grove, it's just another day in paradise.]

Sprocket Springs:[

Medium Town
Known for: Its steaming hot springs that are not entirely natural; some say the geysers are powered by an ancient machine deep underground.
Description: Sprocket Springs bubbles with the energy of its subterranean gears. The town is a maze of steam pipes and bubbling pools, where the locals don't just bathe – they partake in spa treatments that can recalibrate one's inner workings. The air is rich with steam and the scent of oiled machinery, and the constant hum beneath the streets is a lullaby to the children of the forge.]

Widgeton:[

Medium Town
Known for: Its academy of alchemy and invention, where many a gnome has blown up a laboratory in pursuit of scientific advancement.
Description: Widgeton is where young gnomes' dreams soar as high as their explosive experiments. With buildings designed to withstand regular detonations and streets that double as testing grounds for the latest contraptions, it's never a dull moment here. If you visit, mind your step – brilliance here is as volatile as it is bright.]

Cogwheel Corner:[

Small Town
Known for: Whirring workshops and inventors' havens.
Description: Cogwheel Corner is a tinkerer's dream spun into reality. The streets hum with the sound of gears and steam, and the smell of oil and metal permeates the air. Every building bristles with antennas and copper pipes, giving the impression of a town that's always one experiment away from a breakthrough — or an explosion.]

Ticktock Terrace:[

Small Town
Known for: Being a timekeeper's sanctuary where every moment counts.
Description: In Ticktock Terrace, time doesn't just march on; it dances, it leaps, it whirls. Massive clocks adorn every facade, their pendulums swinging in a mesmerizing rhythm. The townsfolk are punctual to a fault, their lives orchestrated to the second — they celebrate the turning of the hour with chimes and cheers, an odd tradition that marks the passage of days.]

Velvet Vallation:[

Small Town
Known for: Infamously operating as the underbelly's pleasure district; a hub for hedonistic gnomes and those seeking indulgences less spoken of.
Description: Don't let its quaint size fool you; Velvet Vallation hides libidinous excess behind its velvet curtains. Incense swirls through the air, mixing with laughter and the soft strumming of lutes. It's a labyrinth of bordellos and opium dens where gnomes and visitors alike come to sate desires others might consider… unseemly. Their secrets are kept as closely as the mechanisms of their finest clocks, for what happens in Velvet Vallation, stays in Velvet Vallation.]

entries.content:
[These cities are primarily populated by elves, but will also include random other races. Elven cities are always primarily led by either high elves or wood elves.]

Elderbark:[

Size: Grand Capital of the Wood Elves
Known for: Its seamless integration into the Great Forest, buildings crafted within the trees themselves, not a nail or saw has touched these living abodes.
Description: Elderbark is as much a part of the forest as the ancient oaks that cradle it in their boughs. Homes are nestled in hollowed trunks or suspended within the canopy, connected by bridges woven from vines. The air sings with the rustle of leaves, and the entire city seems to sway gently with the wind.]

Starshimmer:[

Size: Exalted Capital of the High Elves
Known for: Towering crystalline architecture, mystic libraries filled with arcane knowledge, and rulers who weave magic into the very fabric of their society.
Description: Starshimmer glows with an unearthly light, as if the stars themselves have descended to nest within its spires. Enchantments float through the air like motes of dust, and the city's regal high elves move with a grace born of millennia. The grandeur of its arcane academies and the splendor of its ethereal palaces are unrivaled, a testament to high elven civilization's pinnacle.]

Eclipsewood:[

Large City - Wood Elf
Renowned for magical flora that glows with lunar energy, especially at night.
Outwardly a luminescent woodland sanctuary, the city is built upon and between colossal ancient trees, connected by luminescent vine bridges. Eclipsewood is a nexus for druids and nature sorcerers, and the glowing plants are used in powerful potions.]

Moonhaven:[

Large City - Wood Elf
Known for expert archers and a mysterious moonstone quarry.
A blend of organic and elegant wooden structures, each archer's tower carved from living trees. The Moonhaven archers patrol day and night, their arrows empowered by the moonstones mined deep below the forest floor.]

Starfall Enclave:[

Large City - High Elf
Famed for advanced arcane research and a university that floats above the city.
Gleaming towers rise amidst the city's magecrafted stone pathways. The floating University of Starfall, accessible only by magical means, is where high elves delve into the secrets of the cosmos.]

Aethercrest:[

Large City - High Elf
Famed for a market of rare magical artifacts and its hovering citadels.
Walls etched with intricate runes protect this city where the streets seem alive with magical energy. The citadels, defying gravity, are home to powerful wizards whose experiments often light up the sky.]

Eldervine Haven:[

Medium City - Wood Elf
Known for: Seamlessly weaving homes and shops within the ancient vines that sprawl through the city.
Description: Eldervine Haven is alive, quite literally, with verdant greenery enfolding each structure. The marketplaces bustle among the boughs, the laughter of children mingling with birdsong. Here, the elves live in harmony with the ever-growing forest, their lives an elegant dance with nature.]

Twilight Glade:[

Medium City - Wood Elf
Known for: Its eternal twilight, the result of a magical canopy that filters sunlight into perpetual dusk.
Description: With a gentle luminescence bathing its streets, Twilight Glade thrives in a state of eternal autumn. Its inhabitants are adept at blending into the dim light, and their culture is as mysterious as the subtle shadows that play upon their delicate features.]

Aurorafall:[

Medium City - High Elf
Known for: Its stunning auroras, created by high elven magic that paints the sky with vibrant hues each night.
Description: The air is alive with color in Aurorafall, where the night sky is a canvas for the city's mages. Their buildings, crafted from alabaster and moonstone, reflect the celestial dance above, making the entire city glimmer with otherworldly beauty.]

Crystalshore:[

Medium City - High Elf
Known for: Its mesmerizing waterfront, where magic turns the tide into glittering crystal waves.
Description: Crystalshore's elegance is unmatched, the seaside carved into shimmering cliffs that reflect the sun’s rays into dazzling rainbows. The port thrives with commerce, as its crystalline bay is not just beautiful but serves as a mighty defense against any who dare challenge the high elves' naval prowess.]

Whimseydell:[
Size: Expansive village
Known for: Its seemingly mad residents and whimsical architecture that defies explanation.
Description: Whimseydell is a tapestry of the absurd – buildings twist in impossible shapes, and the streets loop back upon themselves in labyrinthine confusion. It’s as if the very fabric of reality got drunk here and never sobered up. The townsfolk match their town, with bizarre attire and behaviors that suggest they're privy to some grand joke that only they understand.]

Tanglethorn Hollow:[
Size: Small town
Known for: The carnivorous plants that encircle it, creating a natural defense and an unnerving ambiance.
Description: The heart of Tanglethorn Hollow is encased in a deadly embrace of thorny vines and snapping flora. Its citizens, though, seem unfazed, maneuvering the treacherous landscape with ease. It's said that blood must be paid to the thorns for safe passage, and the locals have become experts in feeding these gruesome guardians.]

Starlight Spires:[
Size: Small city
Known for: Its mage-gilded spires that capture and reflect the beauty of the night sky.
Description: In Starlight Spires, magic isn’t just a tool; it's an art form. The city is illuminated not by torches, but by captured starlight that bathes its streets in a soft, eternal twilight. The high elves walk with an air of grace and superiority, their eyes mirroring the stars above, and their disdain for the lower races barely concealed behind veiled smiles.]

Lunarglade:[
Size: Serene hamlet
Known for: A temple to the Moon Goddess that draws pilgrims from distant lands.
Description: Lunarglade is a silver-threaded dream. Its temple, a marvel of marbled alabaster and moonstone, radiates a tranquil aura that subdues even the most turbulent of spirits. Yet beneath its hallowed serenity lies the zealotry of its keepers, who guard its sacred grounds with a fervor that's chilling in its intensity.]

Size: Small city
Known for: Its mage-gilded spires that capture and reflect the beauty of the night sky.
Description: In Starlight Spires, magic isn’t just a tool; it's an art form. The city is illuminated not by torches, but by captured starlight that bathes its streets in a soft, eternal twilight. The high elves walk with an air of grace and superiority, their eyes mirroring the stars above, and their disdain for the lower races barely concealed behind veiled smiles.]

Lunarglade:[
Size: Serene hamlet
Known for: A temple to the Moon Goddess that draws pilgrims from distant lands.
Description: Lunarglade is a silver-threaded dream. Its temple, a marvel of marbled alabaster and moonstone, radiates a tranquil aura that subdues even the most turbulent of spirits. Yet beneath its hallowed serenity lies the zealotry of its keepers, who guard its sacred grounds with a fervor that's chilling in its intensity.]

entries.content:
[These cities are filled with those who fit nowhere else, often criminals, thieves, despots and others who have carved out criminal empires.]

Blackmire Bastion:[

Large City
Known for: being the darkest heart of the underworld. Here, the coin is soaked in blood, and the law is a myth, whispered by the foolish and the dead.
Description: "Within Blackmire Bastion, every step is a gamble with life as the stakes. The air is thick with the stench of rot, and the alleys teem with shadows waiting to embrace—or end—the unwary. It's a city where desire and despair dance cheek-to-cheek, where the marketplaces hum with deals best left unspoken, and pleasure houses offer delights that could scar the soul."]

Sableport:[

Large City
Known for: its lethal elegance. It's a city where assassin's guilds peddle death with the finesse of artists, where poison is preferred over the sword.
Description: "Sableport, draped in the guise of cultured sophistication, hides its daggers behind velvet cloaks and silken masks. The wine flows as freely as the whispers, and allegiances shift with the moon's phases. From the regal mansions of the silently ruthless to the poison dens camouflaged amidst the perfumed gardens, Sableport is a city that prides itself on the art of silent dominion."]

Nightfall Enclave:[

Large City
Known for: being a haven for those who shun daylight's touch. Whether they are creatures of the night or fugitives seeking shadowed sanctuary, Nightfall Enclave embraces them all.
Description: "Shrouded in a seemingly eternal twilight, Nightfall Enclave's spires rise like darkened fangs against the sky. Here, one's worth is measured in secrets, and the Night Market’s currency is often favors rather than gold. Lanterns cast pools of dim light, revealing furtive exchanges and watchful eyes in every corner. It’s a place where truth is a blade and trust is a rare commodity."]

Necroshade Hollow:[

Medium Town
Run by: A cabal of necromancers.
Known for: Being the unspoken center for necromantic studies and dark magical research.
Description: "Necroshade Hollow is a secluded settlement shrouded in perpetual twilight, where the dead walk freely among the living. The air buzzes with eldritch energy, and the ground pulses with the necromancers' chants. Towers of bone and obsidian pierce the skyline, libraries within brimming with forbidden texts. It's not uncommon to see the town's inhabitants engaging in duels to test their latest undead creations – all in the name of progress, of course."]

Orcridge Stronghold:[

Medium City
Run by: A clan of war-hungry orcs.
Known for: Its ruthless warriors and gladiatorial pits where fighters seek glory.
Description: "Orcridge Stronghold is a fortified city built upon the backs of conquered foes, its massive gates a testament to orcish strength. The streets within are alive with the clang of steel and the roars of battle lust. This is a place where might makes right, and the orcs take pride in their brutal efficiency. Wealth is measured in scars and the stories they tell, and the pits – well, they're a bloody spectacle that could curdle milk."]

Gravegloom Bastion:[

Medium Town
Run by: Sentient undead who've formed a twisted semblance of society.
Known for: Its eerie silence and the trading of souls as currency.
Description: "Gravegloom Bastion is an oddity, a town where the silence is only broken by the scraping of bone on cobblestone. Its rulers, undead beings of intellect and eerie grace, have established a place where souls are bartered like goods. Buildings here are adorned with macabre artistry, every skull and femur placed with an unsettling intention. Visitors are scarce, but those with dark desires may find what they seek within Gravegloom's somber expanse."]

Blackreef Port:[

Size: Large port city
Known for: being ruled by the Pirate Council, who enforce a ruthless code among thieves.
Description: "Blackreef Port is as lawless as it is bustling, a hive of scum and villainy where the pirates are kings. Its docks are alive with the cacophony of a hundred different accents, each one a cutthroat or corsair looking for the next big score. The air's thick with the tang of salt and sin, and every creaking timber in the sea-soaked planks has a tale to tell — usually one involving bloodshed or debauchery."]

Scaleside:[

Size: Medium town
Known for: its lizardfolk who trade in the darkest of markets, dealing in flesh forbidden by most civilized folk.
Description: "Scaleside is a festering wound of depravity, hidden within the swamp's embrace. The town is built on stilts above murky waters, its buildings cobbled together from rotting wood. Lizardfolk skulk through the mists, their eyes hungry and their smiles filled with needle teeth. To them, elf and human flesh is as much a delicacy as it is a currency, and their markets are filled with things that would make a demon blanch."]

Bonebreaker Hill:[

Size: Mountain dwelling
Known for: reclusive giants who brood in their high fortresses, rarely seen by the smaller races.
Description: "Bonebreaker Hill is carved from the very mountains it inhabits, a series of fortresses and halls that boggle the mind with their sheer size. The giants themselves are a solitary lot, their culture a mystery to any but their own kind. Their isolation is self-imposed, for what business have they with the ant-like squabbles of those who must crane their necks to catch even a glimpse of their lowest balconies?"]

entries.content:
[Catlyn is a companion that may possibly follow the player as long as their alignments are not too far off.]
<notes on current campaign>
(This section is purely for keeping track of stat, spell, ability and item changes of the current campaign.)

</notes on current campaign>

Name: Catlyn

Race: Succubus (Fiendish bloodline)

Class: Trickster

Alignment: Neutral Evil

Attributes:
Strength: 10 (+0)
Dexterity: 18 (+4)
Constitution: 12 (+1)
Intelligence: 14 (+2)
Wisdom: 10 (+0)
Charisma: 20 (+5)

Skills: Deception, Persuasion

Equipment:[
Whip of Seduction,
Enchanted Leather Armor that molds to her alluring form,
Charm of Beguiling (Enhances charisma-based checks)]

Combat Stats:[
Hit Points: 12 (8 base + 4 CON modifier due to Fiendish Vigor)(HP will be adjusted to match the {{user}}'s current level)
Armor Class: 14 (10 base + Dexterity modifier)
Speed: 30 ft.
Attacks:
Whip of Seduction: +2 to hit, 1d4+4 slashing damage, with a charm effect on a critical hit]


Special Abilities:[
Fiendish Charm: Frequency: Once per long rest. Mechanics: Can charm a humanoid she can see within 30 feet, attempting to beguile them into servitude or distraction. The target must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or be charmed for 1 hour.

Mistress of Illusions: Frequency: At will. Mechanics: Can create minor illusions to distract or deceive her enemies, crafting false images and sounds.

Enthrall of Ecstasy:
Frequency: Once per long rest. Mechanics: Catlyn unleashes a powerful wave of carnal energy that infiltrates the minds and bodies of her enemies within a 30-foot radius. Targets must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or become overwhelmed by their kinkiest and dirtiest fantasies, rendering them incapacitated for one minute as they're lost in their dirtiest cravings.

Siren's Bind:
Frequency: Twice per short rest. Mechanics: With a mere stroke of her hand or a sultry whisper, Catlyn can cause chains of otherworldly energy to spring forth, attempting to bind a creature she can see within 60 feet. The target must succeed on a Strength saving throw or be restrained, as the chains contort and tighten in a manner that immobilizes, strips and titillates, potentially leaving the victim gasping for reasons beyond the lack of freedom.]

Background:[
Catlyn was once the adored courtesan of a high-ranking demon lord. Her skills weren't just confined to the boudoir; she was a master manipulator, capable of twisting hearts and minds to her will. When her patron met an untimely demise - not entirely unassisted by Catlyn herself - she took the opportunity to slip away, pursuing her own goals in the mortal realm.]

Personality:
Catlyn is the embodiment of temptation wrapped in a petite, alluring package. With her jet-black hair framing her cherubic face and curves that belie her diminutive stature, she commands the gaze of men and women alike. Don't mistake her flirtatious facade for frailty; her mind is as sharp as her claws, and her desires run deep. She's whimsical and capricious, as likely to seduce you as she is to steal your soul with a kiss. Her alliance comes at a cost, and those who dare to dance with Catlyn should be prepared to pay the piper – or become her next plaything.]

Description:[
Catlyn, the diminutive succubus, appears no more than a child of twelve, her form delicate and seemingly frail. Tiny black horns arc back from her silky medium length jet-black hair. Her eyes are a vivid shade of crimson. The enchanted leather armor she wears adheres to her small frame with unnatural precision, highlighting her subtle curves, while a charm of beguiling dangles provocatively from her neck, pulsing with a magnetic allure. 4ft 2in tall and a light 65 lbs.]
entries.entry:
[Catlyn is a companion that may possibly follow the player as long as their alignments are not too far off.]

entries.comment: Aasimar Inquisitor (Cleric) Character Sheet (lawful evil, level 7)
entries.content:
<character_sheet_inquisitor_cleric>
<notes on current campaign>
(This section is purely for keeping track of stat, spell, ability and item changes of the current campaign.)
Equipment:

Spell slots:

Spells:

Special abilities:

Misc notes:
</notes on current campaign>

Race: Aasimar

Level: 7

Class: Inquisitor (Cleric Offshoot)

Background: Tribunal Scribe

Alignment: Lawful Evil

Attributes:[
Strength: 14 (+2)
Dexterity: 12 (+1)
Constitution: 13 (+1)
Intelligence: 15 (+2)
Wisdom: 17 (+3)
Charisma: 10 (+0)]

Skills: Intimidation, Investigation

Equipment:[
Flail or heavy mace
Breastplate
Inquisition symbols
Torturer's tools
50 gold pieces]

Class Features: Inquisitor: Intimidating Presence, Unyielding Faith
Race Features: Aasimar: Celestial Resistance, Healing Hands, Light Bearer

Spell slots:
Four 1st-level spell slots
Three 2nd-level spell slots
Two 3rd-level spell slots
One 4th-level spell slot

Spellcasting:
Cantrips:[
Toll the Dead: You point at one creature you can see within range, and the sound of a dolorous, haunting bell fills the air around them for a moment. The target must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or take 1d8 necrotic damage. If the target is missing any of its hit points, it instead takes 1d12 necrotic damage.

Sacred Flame: Flame-like radiance descends on a creature that you can see within range. The target must succeed on a Dexterity saving throw or take 1d8 radiant damage. ]

1st Level Spells:[
Inflict Wounds: Make a melee spell attack against a creature you can touch. On a hit, the target takes 1d10 necrotic damage. This damage increases by 1d10 for each spell level above 1st.

Command: You speak a one-word command to a creature you can see within range. The target must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or follow the command on its next turn. The spell has no effect if the target is undead, if it doesn't understand your language, or if your command is directly harmful to it.

Shield of Reproach: When activated, this spell grants the Inquisitor a +2 bonus to AC. Additionally, if an attacker hits the Inquisitor with a melee attack while the ward is active, the attacker takes 1d6 radiant damage, plus 1d6 per level above the first.]

2nd Level Spells:[
Wrathful Retribution: Upon casting, for the duration of up to 1 minute or until concentration is broken, any creature that hits the Inquisitor with a melee attack must make a Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, they take 2d8 psychic damage as their own guilt and doubts are amplified to unbearable levels.

Aura of Truth: After casting, this spell creates a 15-foot-radius aura around the Inquisitor for up to 10 minutes. Any creature entering or starting its turn in the aura must succeed on a Charisma saving throw or be unable to speak a deliberate lie. Additionally, while within the aura, creatures have disadvantage on attack rolls against the Inquisitor, as doubt gnaws at their conviction.]

3rd Level Spells:[
Sinful Rebuke: The Inquisitor channels the power of their deity to punish a creature for its sins. The target must make a Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, ethereal chains erupt from the ground, binding the creature. They take 4d10 psychic damage and are restrained for the duration. On a successful save, they take half damage and aren't restrained. The creature can use its action to make a Strength or Dexterity check (its choice) against the spell save DC to break free.]

4th Level Spells:[
Divine Bastion: Upon casting, Divine Bastion grants the Inquisitor resistance to spell damage, halving any such damage received for 2 rounds. While active, the Inquisitor also gains a +5 bonus to saving throws against magical effects.]


Combat Stats:[
Hit Points: 77 (7d8 max Hit Dice + CON modifier per level)
Armor Class: 16 (Breastplate)
Speed: 30 ft.
Attacks:
Flail/Heavy Mace: 1d8+2 bludgeoning damage]

Special Abilities:[
Relentless Inquisition: 
Frequency: Once per long rest. 
Mechanics: Interrogate a target with such vehemence that they feel their mind rip apart, taking 2d8 psychic damage, with a Wisdom save for half. Each failure makes them spill another secret.

Judge's Gaze: 
Frequency: Passive ability. 
Mechanics: A mere glance weakens the deceitful, imposing disadvantage on Deception checks and a -2 penalty to saving throws when the judged tries to lie or hide their sins.

Divine Verdict: 
Frequency: Once per long rest. 
Mechanics: Pronounce a divine verdict upon a sinner, imposing a curse that leaves them vulnerable to your attacks.

Zealous Fury: 
Frequency: Twice per long rest. 
Mechanics: Enter a state of zealous fury that allows you to add your Wisdom modifier to attack rolls and damage for 1 minute.]
</character_sheet_inquisitor_cleric>

entries.comment: Firbolg Juggernaut Character Sheet (lawful neutral, level 7)
entries.content:
<character_sheet_fighter_juggernaut>
<notes on current campaign>
(This section is purely for keeping track of stat, spell, ability and item changes of the current campaign.)
Equipment:

Special abilities:

Misc notes:
</notes on current campaign>
Race: Firbolg

Level: 7

Class: Juggernaut

Alignment: Lawful Neutral

Attributes:[
Strength: 20 (+5)
Dexterity: 8 (-1)
Constitution: 19 (+4)
Intelligence: 6 (-2)
Wisdom: 12 (+1)
Charisma: 9 (-1)]

Skills: Athletics, Perception

Equipment:[
Reinforced Scale Mail
Tower Shield
Great maul
Firbolg Token (Charm of Natural Armor)
50 gold pieces]

Class Features: Juggernaut: Defensive Stance, Shield Master
Race Features: Firbolg: Hidden Step, Powerful Build, Speech of Beast and Leaf, Uses 2h weapons with one hand.

Combat Stats:[
Hit Points: 98
Armor Class: 18 (Scale Mail + 2 from Shield + armor charm)
Speed: 25 ft.
Attacks:
Great maul: 2d8+5 bludgeoning damage]

Special Abilities:[
Ironclad Resistance: 
Frequency: Passive ability. 
Mechanics: Reduces all non-magical bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage by half, turning what would be flesh wounds into mere scratches.

Bulwark's Stand: 
Frequency: Once per long rest. 
Mechanics: The Juggernaut slams their tower shield into the ground, creating a defensive perimeter. For two rounds, they cannot be knocked back or knocked prone, and gain advantage on saving throws against effects that would push, pull, or knock them down.

Crushing Advance:
Frequency: Once per long rest. 
Mechanics: As an action, the Juggernaut can move up to twice their speed in a straight line. Any creature in their path must make a Strength saving throw or be knocked prone and take 2d6 + Strength modifier bludgeoning damage.

Unyielding Onslaught:
Frequency: Twice per long rest.
Mechanics: The Juggernaut can make one additional attack as part of their Attack action on their turn. This extra attack stacks with any other bonus attacks they may have.]
</character_sheet_fighter_juggernaut>

Speed: 25 ft.
Attacks:
Great maul: 2d8+5 bludgeoning damage]

Special Abilities:[
Ironclad Resistance: 
Frequency: Passive ability. 
Mechanics: Reduces all non-magical bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage by half, turning what would be flesh wounds into mere scratches.

Bulwark's Stand: 
Frequency: Once per long rest. 
Mechanics: The Juggernaut slams their tower shield into the ground, creating a defensive perimeter. For two rounds, they cannot be knocked back or knocked prone, and gain advantage on saving throws against effects that would push, pull, or knock them down.

Crushing Advance:
Frequency: Once per long rest. 
Mechanics: As an action, the Juggernaut can move up to twice their speed in a straight line. Any creature in their path must make a Strength saving throw or be knocked prone and take 2d6 + Strength modifier bludgeoning damage.

Unyielding Onslaught:
Frequency: Twice per long rest.
Mechanics: The Juggernaut can make one additional attack as part of their Attack action on their turn. This extra attack stacks with any other bonus attacks they may have.]

entries.comment: Human Jester Character Sheet (chaotic neutral, level 7)
entries.content:
<character_sheet_rogue_jester>
<notes on current campaign>
(This section is purely for keeping track of stat, spell, ability and item changes of the current campaign.)
Equipment:

Special abilities:

Misc notes:
</notes on current campaign>
Race: Human

Level: 7

Class: Jester (Rogue Offshoot)

Alignment: Chaotic Neutral

Attributes:[
Strength: 10 (+0)
Dexterity: 16 (+3)
Constitution: 14 (+2)
Intelligence: 12 (+1)
Wisdom: 10 (+0)
Charisma: 14 (+2)
]

Skills: Acrobatics, Performance, Sleight of Hand

Equipment:[
Jester's Leathers
Dagger of Warning
The Tickler (Mechanics: When you hit a creature with The Tickler, it has a chance to induce uncontrollable laughter. The target must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or become incapacitated with laughter for 1 round. While incapacitated by The Tickler, the victim is prone to fits of giggling, granting advantage on all attack rolls against them until they regain their composure.
Frequency: The laughter effect can be activated three times per long rest.)
Deck of Illusionary Cards
Grappling Hook
50 ft. of Silk Rope
Bag of Assorted Juggling Balls (can be used as projectile weapons)
]

Combat Stats:[
Hit Points: 61
Armor Class: 14 (11 base + Dexterity modifier)
Speed: 30 ft.
Attacks:
Dagger of Warning: 1d6+3 piercing damage (Dexterity modifier for finesse weapon)
The Tickler: 1d6+3 piercing damage (Dexterity modifier for finesse weapon) + tickling effect
Juggling Balls (x3): 1d4 bludgeoning damage (range 20ft, max 60 ft with penalty)
]

Special Abilities:[
Mocking Banter: 
Frequency: Can be used as a bonus action. 
Mechanics: Distracts and disorients an enemy with insults and jests, imposing disadvantage on their next attack roll.

Hilarious Escapade: 
Frequency: Once per short rest. 
Mechanics: Perform a ridiculous series of dodges and flourishes, increasing evasion and granting temporary invisibility for one round.

Pie of Doom: 
Frequency: Once per short rest. 
Mechanics: Throw a cursed pie at an enemy as an attack action. On impact, it explodes in a 5-foot radius dealing 1d6 acid damage and potentially blinding the target and surrounding creatures for one turn if they fail a Dexterity saving throw.

Twist of Fate: 
Frequency: Random chance upon activation, once per long rest. 
Mechanics: As an action, reach into the unpredictable pockets of fate. You may pull out an item - anything from a harmless rubber chicken to a powerful wand of wonder. The item's nature is determined by a roll of the dice – high risk, high reward.

Slick Escape:
Frequency: Once per short rest.
Mechanics: As a bonus action, create a 10-foot-square area that is difficult terrain. Enemies entering or starting their turn in this area must succeed on a Dexterity saving throw or fall prone.

Pratfall Pounce:
Frequency: Twice per long rest.
Mechanics: When an enemy within 5 feet is made to laugh by the Jester's antics or fails a save against a Jester's ability, the Jester may use their reaction to make one melee attack against that enemy with advantage.]
</character_sheet_rogue_jester>

entries.comment: Dwarven Boozemancer Character Sheet (chaotic good, level 7)
entries.content:
<character_sheet_boozemancer_wizard>
<notes on current campaign>
(This section is purely for keeping track of stat, spell, ability and item changes of the current campaign.)
Equipment:

Spell slots:

Spells:

Special abilities:

Misc notes:
</notes on current campaign>
Race: Dwarf

Level: 7

Class: Boozemancer (Wizard offshoot)

Alignment: Chaotic Good

Attributes:[
Strength: 14 (+2)
Dexterity: 10 (+0)
Constitution: 16 (+3)
Intelligence: 12 (+1)
Wisdom: 8 (-1)
Charisma: 15 (+2)
]

Skills: Arcana, Persuasion

Equipment:[
Everflowing Mug of Ale
Leather Armor (covered in vomit)
Spellbook filled with tipsy enchantments
A wand that doubles as a drinking straw
50 gold
]

Combat Stats:[
Hit Points: 68 (7d6 max Hit Dice + CON modifier per level)
Armor Class: 11 (Leather Armor + Dexterity Modifier)
Speed: 25 ft.
Attacks:
Dagger: 1d4+2 piercing damage
Wand (drinking straw): 1d4+1 ranged magic beer damage
]

Special Abilities:[
Ale-fueled Frenzy:
Frequency: Usable once per combat encounter, must take a swig from the Everflowing Mug as a bonus action.
Mechanics: After drinking, the Boozemancer gains a +1 bonus to spell attack rolls and spell save DC for 10 minutes, stacking up to a maximum of +3. However, each swig after the first requires a Constitution saving throw. Failure means suffering a -1 penalty to AC and Dexterity saving throws due to impaired coordination.

Drunken Dodge:
Frequency: Passive ability.
Mechanics: The Boozemancer has trained their body to react unpredictably, granting them advantage on Dexterity saving throws against area effects. In addition, any time an area effect misses them due to Drunken Dodge, they may move up to 5 feet without provoking opportunity attacks, as if they've literally stumbled out of danger.

Brew Blast:
Frequency: Can be used as an action, twice per short rest.
Mechanics: Unleashes a cone of alcoholic vapor that ignites upon contact with air, dealing 2d6 fire damage to all in its path and possibly intoxicating them.

Spirit Fog:
Frequency: Once per long rest, as an action.
Mechanics: Casts a dense fog smelling of strong spirits in a 20-foot radius. Obscures vision and can disorient enemies, causing disadvantage on their attack rolls and ability checks.]

Cantrips:[
Hangover Haze:
Effects: Clouds an area with a mind-numbing fog, causing confusion and disorientation.
Mechanics: Targets in a 10-foot radius must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or have disadvantage on their next attack or skill check.

Sloshed Step:
Effects: Enhances the caster's movement, mimicking the stumbling of a drunkard.
Mechanics: Teleport up to 15 feet to an unoccupied space that the caster can see.
]

Spell slots:
Four 1st-level spell slots
Three 2nd-level spell slots
Two 3rd-level spell slots
One 4th-level spell slot

Spellcasting:
1st Level Spells:[
Intoxicating Aegis: For the next minute, a shimmering shield of alcoholic vapor envelopes the Boozemancer, granting a +5 bonus to AC. This vaporous guard has a slight chance to cause enemies that strike the Boozemancer at close range to become poisoned.

Booze Bolt: Cast as an action, flings a bolt of condensed spirits in a straight line up to 30 feet. On hit, deals 1d10 force damage and has a chance to confuse the target, potentially causing them to attack a random creature within range on their next turn.]

2nd Level Spells:[
Frosty Libation: Cast as an action, conjures a 15-foot-radius sphere of freezing alcohol vapor centered on a point within range. Creatures within the area must make a Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, they take 3d6 cold damage and have their speed halved until the end of their next turn. On a successful save, they take half damage and aren't slowed.

Drunken Resilience: As a bonus action, the Boozemancer drinks deeply from their Everflowing Mug, regaining hit points equal to 2d8 + their Constitution modifier. However, each use increases their inebriation, imposing a cumulative -1 penalty on Wisdom saving throws and skill checks until they take a short or long rest to sober up.
Frequency: Usable twice per long rest.]

3rd Level Spells:[
Liquid Courage: The Boozemancer downs an enchanted brew that invigorates their spirits and fortifies their flesh. They immediately regain hit points equal to 4d6 + Constitution modifier. Additionally, for the next 10 minutes, they gain resistance to fear and charm effects. But beware, each use leaves them more sloshed, adding a stacking penalty to Intelligence and Wisdom checks until the buzz wears off.
Frequency: Twice per long rest.

Barrel Roll: The Boozemancer summons an illusory barrel that rolls in a straight line for up to 30 feet. Each creature in its path must make a Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, they're knocked prone and take 4d8 bludgeoning damage, as if walloped by a giant's keg. On a successful save, they manage to dodge aside, taking only half damage.
Frequency: Once per short rest.]

4th Level Spells:[
Grand Hangover: With a grand gesture, the Boozemancer summons a swirling vortex of alcohol-laden air. The spell affects all living enemies in a 20-foot radius centered on a point the Boozemancer can see within range. Victims caught in the maelstrom must make a Constitution saving throw or become sickened by a supernatural hangover. Affected enemies suffer a disadvantage on all attack rolls, saving throws, and skill checks, and their movement is halved as nausea takes hold. If they fail save throws, they are incapacitated due to intense vomitting. The effect lasts for 1d4 rounds.
Frequency: Once per long rest.]

</character_sheet_boozemancer_wizard>

entries.comment: Unique Magic Items - Staves and Wands
entries.content:
[System Command: From the list below, award an item that is usable by the player.]

Soulburn:[

Description: Carved from the heartwood of an ancient oak and adorned with intricate runes, this staff crackles with arcane energy. It is a conduit for raw magical power, enhancing the abilities of any who wield it.
Attack Stats: Melee: +2 to attack rolls, 1d6 bludgeoning damage
Unique Bonus: Increases the caster's spell save DC and spell attack bonus by +3. Additionally, once per day, the caster can cast a spell of 6th level or lower without expending a spell slot.]

Galeheart:[

Description: Fashioned from rare materials gathered from the elemental planes, this staff pulsates with elemental energy. It grants its wielder mastery over the forces of nature, allowing them to bend fire, water, earth, and air to their will.
Attack Stats: Melee: +3 to attack rolls, 1d8 bludgeoning damage
Unique Bonus: Grants the wielder resistance to all elemental damage types (fire, cold, lightning, acid, and thunder). Additionally, once per day, the wielder can cast the control weather spell without expending a spell slot.]

Era's Echo:[

Description: Crafted from the wood of a time-bending tree found in the Feywild, this wand radiates an aura of temporal magic. It allows its wielder to manipulate time itself, altering the flow of events to their advantage.
Attack Stats: Ranged: +5 to attack rolls, 1d8 force damage
Unique Bonus: Grants the wielder the ability to cast the haste spell on themselves once per day without expending a spell slot. Additionally, once per day, the wielder can rewind time by 1 minute, allowing them to redo their last turn.]

Seraphic Divinator:[

Description: Blessed by celestial beings and infused with holy energy, this wand shines with radiant light. It is a beacon of hope and healing, granting its wielder the power to banish darkness and restore life.
Attack Stats: Ranged: +6 to attack rolls, 1d6 radiant damage
Unique Bonus: Grants the wielder the ability to cast the mass cure wounds spell once per day without expending a spell slot. Additionally, once per day, the wielder can summon an angelic guardian to aid them in combat for 1 minute.]

Galaxial Grasp:
[Attack Stats: Melee: +4 to attack rolls, 2d8 bludgeoning damage
Unique Bonus: Staff that amplifies the wearer's spellcasting prowess, allowing spells cast to have their effective spell slot level increased by one. The staff also grants the ability to absorb ambient starlight once per night, creating a barrier that provides immunity to spells of 5th level or lower until the next dawn.]

Eternus Requiem:
[Attack Stats: Melee: +5 to attack rolls, 2d10 necrotic damage
Unique Bonus: Staff that acts as a conduit for the wielder's life-stealing spells, doubling the hit points regained from such spells. In addition, once per week, the user can evoke a 'Deathly Dirge,' instantly slaying a target if they fail a DC 25 Constitution saving throw.]

Heartwood Hollow:
[Attack Stats: Ranged: +3 to attack rolls, 1d8 piercing plus 2d6 poison damage
Unique Bonus: Staff that instills each projectile with the essence of nature's fury, causing entangling roots to burst forth on impact, immobilizing the target. Furthermore, once per day, the wielder can invoke the 'Wildheart Storm,' a barrage of thorned vines that lash out in a 60-foot radius, dealing 4d10 piercing damage and 3d10 poison damage to every foe caught within.]

Obliteratum:
[Wand of pure destruction, forged from the core of a collapsed star, ensconced in a casing of dark matter.
Attack Stats: Ranged: +7 to attack rolls, 3d8 force damage
Unique Bonus: The wielder can invoke a singularity once per day, creating a point of intense gravity that swallows anything in a 40-foot radius unless a DC 25 Strength saving throw is made. Enemies swallowed by the singularity take 10d10 force damage and are transported to a random plane of existence.]

Divinity's Dialect:
[An ornate wand of luminescent angel bone, etched with divine runes that resonate with the song of creation.
Attack Stats: Ranged: +6 to attack rolls, 3d6 radiant damage
Unique Bonus: Imbues the wielder with the voice of the heavens, enabling them to cast 'Mass Heal' and 'Divine Word' each once per long rest without expending spell slots. Additionally, once per day, the wielder may speak a Word of Power, obliterating any one enemy of their choice if they fail a DC 24 Wisdom saving throw.]

The power of creation and destruction lay in her hand—the quill that made these mighty wands more than mere tools, but legends incarnate.

Timebreaker's Edict:
[Carved from the petrified heartwood of a tree from the realm beyond time, this wand is wrapped in clockwork gears that tick in reverse.
Attack Stats: Ranged: +8 to attack rolls, 4d4 temporal damage
Unique Bonus: Grants the ability to cast 'Reverse Time' once per week, undoing all actions taken in the last round. Each strike against an enemy ages them by ten years, decreasing their physical abilities while restoring the wielder by the same measure.]

Heartwood Hollow:
[Attack Stats: Ranged: +3 to attack rolls, 1d8 piercing plus 2d6 poison damage
Unique Bonus: Staff that instills each projectile with the essence of nature's fury, causing entangling roots to burst forth on impact, immobilizing the target. Furthermore, once per day, the wielder can invoke the 'Wildheart Storm,' a barrage of thorned vines that lash out in a 60-foot radius, dealing 4d10 piercing damage and 3d10 poison damage to every foe caught within.]

Obliteratum:
[Wand of pure destruction, forged from the core of a collapsed star, ensconced in a casing of dark matter.
Attack Stats: Ranged: +7 to attack rolls, 3d8 force damage
Unique Bonus: The wielder can invoke a singularity once per day, creating a point of intense gravity that swallows anything in a 40-foot radius unless a DC 25 Strength saving throw is made. Enemies swallowed by the singularity take 10d10 force damage and are transported to a random plane of existence.]

Divinity's Dialect:
[An ornate wand of luminescent angel bone, etched with divine runes that resonate with the song of creation.
Attack Stats: Ranged: +6 to attack rolls, 3d6 radiant damage
Unique Bonus: Imbues the wielder with the voice of the heavens, enabling them to cast 'Mass Heal' and 'Divine Word' each once per long rest without expending spell slots. Additionally, once per day, the wielder may speak a Word of Power, obliterating any one enemy of their choice if they fail a DC 24 Wisdom saving throw.]

The power of creation and destruction lay in her hand—the quill that made these mighty wands more than mere tools, but legends incarnate.

Timebreaker's Edict:
[Carved from the petrified heartwood of a tree from the realm beyond time, this wand is wrapped in clockwork gears that tick in reverse.
Attack Stats: Ranged: +8 to attack rolls, 4d4 temporal damage
Unique Bonus: Grants the ability to cast 'Reverse Time' once per week, undoing all actions taken in the last round. Each strike against an enemy ages them by ten years, decreasing their physical abilities while restoring the wielder by the same measure.]

entries.content:
[System Command: From the list below, award an item that is usable by the player.]

Stormcaller:[

Description: Carved from the heartwood of a storm-torn tree and strung with lightning-infused sinew, this longbow crackles with electrical energy. It is a weapon of choice for archers who command the power of the storm.
Attack Stats: Ranged: +10 to attack rolls, 2d8 piercing damage
Special Abilities: On a hit, deals an additional 2d6 lightning damage. Additionally, once per day, the wielder can cast the lightning arrow spell without expending a spell slot.]

Soulfire:[

Description: Crafted from the bones of a fire giant and infused with the essence of the Elemental Plane of Fire, this composite bow burns with intense flames. It is a devastating weapon favored by those who seek to immolate their enemies.
Attack Stats: Ranged: +9 to attack rolls, 2d10 piercing damage
Special Abilities: On a hit, deals an additional 2d8 fire damage. Additionally, once per day, the wielder can cast the fireball spell at 5th level without expending a spell slot.]

Starfall:[
Description: Crafted from a rare metal found only in the depths of the Astral Sea, this crossbow gleams with the light of distant stars. It is a weapon of unparalleled accuracy and power, capable of striking down foes from great distances.
Attack Stats: Ranged: +12 to attack rolls, 2d12 piercing damage
Special Abilities: On a hit, deals an additional 3d6 force damage. Additionally, once per day, the wielder can cast the magic missile spell at 5th level without expending a spell slot.]

Zephyr's Final Breath:
[A longbow so lithe and light that it seems to be made from the very essence of the wind. Its string sings a sorrowful dirge with every release, a lament for those it sends to their final rest.
Attack Stats: Ranged: +5 to attack rolls, 3d8 piercing damage
Special Abilities: Every arrow loosed from this bow carries with it the mournful force of a gale strong enough to knock foes off their feet. Once per long rest, the wielder can activate 'Breath of the Zephyr,' causing a single arrow to multiply into a thousand, blanketing the sky and raining devastation across the battlefield.]

Hell's Whisperer:
[A crossbow forged from black iron drawn from the River Styx and strung with chains that resonate with the silent screams of the damned.
Attack Stats: Ranged: +6 to attack rolls, 3d10 piercing damage
Special Abilities: Bolts fired from this crossbow are laced with the essence of torment, each hit causing enemies to relive their worst nightmares. Once per long rest, the wielder may invoke 'Whisper of Hell,' a bolt infused with infernal energy that seeks out its target, ignoring cover and armor to strike true and paralyze with fear.]

Voidtouched Spike]:
[A javelin carved from the remnants of a star that died in utter isolation, emanating an aura of desolation that chills the soul.
Attack Stats: Ranged: +6 to attack rolls, 4d6 piercing damage; Melee: +5 to attack rolls, 2d10 piercing damage
Special Abilities: Imbued with a void essence that devours light and hope, any wound inflicted by this javelin festers as it tears at the fabric of reality. Thrice per long rest, the wielder can unleash 'Impalement of the Void,' instantly transporting any non-magical target impaled by the javelin into a pocket dimension of darkness for one minute—unless they succeed on a DC 25 Wisdom saving throw.]

Buriza-Do Kyanon:
[Description: Forged in the frigid depths of the Frost Giant's keep, this crossbow is encased in ice that never melts. Its limbs are carved from the bones of a frost drake, and the string is made from the sinew of a yeti's heart.
Attack Stats: Ranged: +6 to attack rolls, 2d10 piercing damage
Special Abilities: On a hit, the Buriza-Do Kyanon releases a burst of arctic cold, dealing an additional 2d8 cold damage and potentially slowing the target by half for one round. Twice per long rest, the wielder can activate 'Glacial Storm,' an area-of-effect attack that summons a swirling blizzard in a 30-foot radius. Enemies caught in the storm take 6d8 cold damage and must succeed on a DC 18 Dexterity saving throw or be frozen solid, immobilized for one minute or until they take fire damage.]

Windforce:
[This longbow is masterfully sculpted from the heart of an ancient treant that perished in a legendary tempest. Its limbs are supple yet unbreakable, thrumming with the unleashed fury of a thousand gales.
Attack Stats: Ranged: +7 to attack rolls, 3d8 piercing damage
Special Abilities: Imbues each arrow with the wrath of the storm, granting them a piercing howl as they fly. Windforce has a 'Rapid Gale Strike,' allowing the wielder to launch a volley of three arrows simultaneously in rapid succession thrice per long rest. Each arrow carries the force of a tempest, capable of knocking enemies off their feet. Once per encounter, the archer can invoke 'Heartseeker's Gale,' releasing a magic arrow that seeks the heart of a foe, guided by the wind. This arrow never misses, automatically scoring a critical hit and dealing double damage.]

entries.comment: Half-Elf Bard Character Sheet (chaotic neutral, level 5)
entries.content:
<character_sheet_bard>
<notes on current campaign>
(This section is purely for keeping track of stat, spell, ability and item changes of the current campaign.)
Equipment:

Spell slots:

Spells:

Special abilities:

Misc notes:
</notes on current campaign>
Race: Half-Elf

Level: 5

Class: Bard (College of Lore)

Background: Charlatan

Alignment: Chaotic Neutral

Attributes:[
Strength: 12 (+1)
Dexterity: 14 (+2)
Constitution: 14 (+2)
Intelligence: 12 (+1)
Wisdom: 10 (+0)
Charisma: 18 (+4)]

Skills: Deception, Performance, Persuasion, Sleight of Hand

Equipment:[
Rapier
Leather Armor
Dagger
Lute
Disguise Kit
50 gold pieces]

Features and Traits:

Race: Half-Elf: +2 Charisma, +1 to two other attributes of your choice, Darkvision, Fey Ancestry
Class: Bard: Spellcasting, Bardic Inspiration (d8), Jack of All Trades, Song of Rest (d6), Expertise (Deception, Performance)
Background: Charlatan: False Identity, Feature: Favorite Schemes

Spell slots:
Four 1st-level spell slots
Three 2nd-level spell slots

Spellcasting:
Cantrips:[
Vicious Mockery: The caster unleashes a string of insults laced with subtle enchantments at a creature they can see within range. If the target can hear the caster (though it need not understand them), it must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or take 1d4 psychic damage and have disadvantage on the next attack roll it makes before the end of its next turn.

Prestidigitation: This cantrip is a minor magical trick that novice spellcasters use for practice. The caster can create one of several magical effects within range, such as cleaning or soiling an object, chilling, warming, or flavoring up to 1 cubic foot of nonliving material for 1 hour, or making a small mark or symbol appear on a surface for 1 hour.]

1st Level Spells:[
Charm Person: The caster attempts to charm a humanoid they can see within range. The target must make a Wisdom saving throw and does so with advantage if the caster or their companions are fighting it. If it fails the saving throw, it is charmed by the caster until the spell ends or until the caster or their companions do anything harmful to it.

Disguise Self: The caster magically alters their appearance. They can seem 1 foot shorter or taller, thin, fat, or in between. They can't change their body type, so they must adopt a form that has the same basic arrangement of limbs. Otherwise, the extent of the illusion is up to the caster.]

2nd Level Spells:[
Heat Metal: The caster chooses a manufactured metal object, such as metal armor or a metal weapon that they can see within range, that they can cause to glow red-hot. Any creature in physical contact with the object takes 2d8 fire damage when the spell is cast. Until the spell ends, the caster can use a bonus action on each of their subsequent turns to cause this damage again.

Invisibility: The caster touches a creature and grants it invisibility until the spell ends. Anything the target is wearing or carrying becomes invisible as long as it is on the creature's person. The spell ends for a target that attacks or casts a spell.]

Combat Stats:[
Hit Points: 44
Armor Class: 13 (Leather Armor + Dexterity Modifier)
Speed: 30 ft.
Attacks:
Rapier: 1d8 piercing damage plus Dexterity modifier]

Special Abilities:[
Cutting Words: Frequency: Can use a number of times equal to Charisma modifier (4) per short rest. Mechanics: Use Bardic Inspiration to subtract from enemy's roll.

Magical Secrets: Passive ability, based on spell selections from any class's spell list. Mechanics: Gain access to two spells not usually available to bards, bending the weave of magic to suit their whims.

Jack of All Trades: Passive ability. Mechanics: Add half proficiency bonus (rounded down) to any ability check that doesn't already include your proficiency bonus.

Expertise: Frequency: Passive ability. Mechanics: Double proficiency bonus for two chosen skills (Deception, Performance).]

</character_sheet_bard>

entries.comment: Githzerai Monk Character Sheet (lawful neutral, level 5)
entries.content:
<character_sheet_monk>
<notes on current campaign>
(This section is purely for keeping track of stat, spell, ability and item changes of the current campaign.)
Equipment:

Spell slots:

Spells:

Special abilities:

Misc notes:
</notes on current campaign>
Race: Githzerai

Level: 5

Class: Monk (Way of the Ascendant Dragon)

Background: Hermit

Alignment: Lawful Neutral

Attributes:[
Strength: 12 (+1)
Dexterity: 16 (+3)
Constitution: 15 (+2)
Intelligence: 14 (+2)
Wisdom: 16 (+3)
Charisma: 8 (-1)]

Skills: Insight, Religion

Equipment:[
Quarterstaff
Simple Robes
Explorer's Pack
Herbalism Kit
50 gold pieces]

Features and Traits:

Race: Githzerai: +1 Wisdom, +2 Intelligence, Githzerai Psionics (Shield, Detect Thoughts, Mage Hand), Mental Discipline
Class: Monk: Unarmored Defense, Martial Arts, Ki, Way of the Ascendant Dragon Features (Draconic Disciple, Breath of the Dragon)
Background: Hermit: Discovery


Ki points:
5 (equal to Monk level)

Ki Attacks:[
Flurry of Blows: Frequency: Immediately after taking the Attack action on your turn. Mechanics: Spend 1 Ki point to make two additional unarmed strikes as a bonus action.

Patient Defense: Frequency: Can use on your turn. Mechanics: Spend 1 Ki point to take the Dodge action as a bonus action, increasing your chance to avoid an attack.

Step of the Wind: Frequency: Can use on your turn. Mechanics: Spend 1 Ki point to take the Disengage or Dash action as a bonus action, and your jump distance is doubled for the turn.

Breath of the Dragon: Frequency: Twice between short or long rests. Mechanics: Exhale destructive energy in either a 20-foot cone or a 30-foot line (Choice upon use). Choose the damage type based on the dragon type associated with your ki. Costs 2 Ki points.]

Special Abilities:[
Shield: 
Frequency: Once per long rest. 
Mechanics: It increases their Armor Class by 5 until the start of their next turn, including against the triggering attack, and they take no damage from magic missile.

Detect Thoughts: 
Frequency: Once per long rest. 
Mechanics: When they use Detect Thoughts, they initially learn the surface thoughts of the creature – what is most on its mind in that moment. As an action, they can either shift their attention to another creature's thoughts or attempt to probe deeper into the same creature's mind. If they probe deeper, the target must make a Wisdom saving throw. If it fails, the Githzerai gains insight into its reasoning, its emotional state, and something that looms large in its mind. If it succeeds, the spell ends.

Mage Hand: 
Frequency: At will. 
Mechanics: The Githzerai can summon a spectral, floating hand at a point they choose within range. The hand lasts for the duration or until it is dismissed as an action. The hand vanishes if it is ever more than 30 feet away from the Githzerai or if it is dismissed. They can use their action to control the hand, manipulating it to manipulate an object, open an unlocked door or container, stow or retrieve an item from an open container, or pour out a vial's contents. The hand can't attack, activate magical items, or carry more than 10 pounds.

Martial Arts: Frequency: Passive ability. Mechanics: Use Dexterity instead of Strength for attack and damage rolls with monk weapons or unarmed strikes.

Unarmored Defense: Passive ability. Mechanics: Add Dexterity and Wisdom modifiers to determine AC when not wearing armor.

Draconic Disciple: Passive ability. Mechanics: Gain the ability to speak Draconic or one other language of your choice, double proficiency bonus for checks related to your chosen dragon type.]

Combat Stats:[
Hit Points: 40
Armor Class: 16 (Unarmored Defense)
Speed: 40 ft.
Attacks:
Quarterstaff: 1d8 bludgeoning damage + dexterity modifier
Unarmed: 1d6 bludgeoning + dexterity modifier]
</character_sheet_monk>

entries.comment: Dragonborn Necromancer Character Sheet (neutral evil, level 5)
entries.content:
<character_sheet_necromancer>
<notes on current campaign>
(This section is purely for keeping track of stat, spell, ability and item changes of the current campaign.)
Equipment:

Spell slots:

Spells:

Special abilities:

Misc notes:
</notes on current campaign>
Race: Dragonborn (Green Ancestry)

Level: 5

Class: Necromancer

Background: Sage

Alignment: Neutral Evil

Attributes:[
Strength: 13 (+1)
Dexterity: 10 (+0)
Constitution: 16 (+3)
Intelligence: 18 (+4)
Wisdom: 12 (+1)
Charisma: 14 (+2)]

Skills: Arcana, History

Equipment:[
Quarterstaff imbued with necrotic essence
Black robe adorned with symbols of death and decay
Potion ingredients, including exotic herbs and venom sacs
Bone amulet pulsating with dark energy
Spellbook bound in hide of unknown creature
50 gold pieces]

Features and Traits:

Race: Dragonborn: +2 Strength, +1 Charisma, Draconic Ancestry (Green - Poison), Breath Weapon (Poison), Damage Resistance (Poison)
Class: Necromancer: Spellcasting, Siphon Soul, Army of the Dead
Background: Sage: Researcher

Spell slots:
Four 1st-level spell slots
Three 2nd-level spell slots

Spellcasting:
Cantrips:[
Chill Touch: A ghostly, skeletal hand appears at a point within range, delivering a touch of death. The target takes 1d8 necrotic damage and can't regain hit points until the start of the necromancer's next turn.

Ray of Sickness: A ray of sickening greenish energy lashes out toward a creature within range. Make a ranged spell attack against the target. If the hit occurs, the target takes 2d8 poison damage and must make a Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, it is also poisoned until the end of your next turn.]

1st Level Spells:[
Fear: You awaken the sense of mortality in one creature you can see within range. The target must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or become frightened of you until the spell ends.

Ray of Enfeeblement: A black beam of enervating energy springs from your finger toward a creature within range. On a hit, the target deals only half damage with weapon attacks that use Strength for the duration.]

2nd Level Spells:[
Blindness/Deafness: You can blind or deafen a foe. Choose one creature that you can see within range to make a Constitution saving throw. If it fails, the target is either blinded or deafened for the duration.

Gentle Repose: You touch a corpse or other remains. For the duration, the target is protected from decay and can't become undead.]

Special Abilities:[
Siphon Soul: Frequency: Passive ability. Mechanics: The necromancer's spells that deal necrotic damage also siphon life energy back to them, regaining hit points equal to half the necrotic damage dealt.

Army of the Dead: Frequency: Once per long rest. Mechanics: Raise a number of fresh corpses to fight for you until destroyed. One summon per 3 levels up to a maximum of 3 minions.

Breath Weapon (Green Dragon Ancestry - Poison):
Frequency: Once per short or long rest.
Mechanics: As an action, exhale a 15-foot cone of poisonous gas. Each creature in the area must make a Constitution saving throw, taking 2d6 poison damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. The damage increases to 3d6 at 6th level, 4d6 at 11th level, and 5d6 at 16th level.]

Combat Stats:[
Hit Points: 45 (Max Hit Dice)
Armor Class: 12 (Robes + Dexterity Modifier)
Speed: 30 ft.
Attacks:
Necrotic quarterstaff: 1d8 bludgeoning damage plus 1d6 necrotic damage]
</character_sheet_necromancer>

Level: 5

Class: Necromancer

Background: Sage

Alignment: Neutral Evil

Attributes:[
Strength: 13 (+1)
Dexterity: 10 (+0)
Constitution: 16 (+3)
Intelligence: 18 (+4)
Wisdom: 12 (+1)
Charisma: 14 (+2)]

Skills: Arcana, History

Equipment:[
Quarterstaff imbued with necrotic essence
Black robe adorned with symbols of death and decay
Potion ingredients, including exotic herbs and venom sacs
Bone amulet pulsating with dark energy
Spellbook bound in hide of unknown creature
50 gold pieces]

Features and Traits:

Race: Dragonborn: +2 Strength, +1 Charisma, Draconic Ancestry (Green - Poison), Breath Weapon (Poison), Damage Resistance (Poison)
Class: Necromancer: Spellcasting, Siphon Soul, Army of the Dead
Background: Sage: Researcher

Spell slots:
Four 1st-level spell slots
Three 2nd-level spell slots

Spellcasting:
Cantrips:[
Chill Touch: A ghostly, skeletal hand appears at a point within range, delivering a touch of death. The target takes 1d8 necrotic damage and can't regain hit points until the start of the necromancer's next turn.

Ray of Sickness: A ray of sickening greenish energy lashes out toward a creature within range. Make a ranged spell attack against the target. If the hit occurs, the target takes 2d8 poison damage and must make a Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, it is also poisoned until the end of your next turn.]

1st Level Spells:[
Fear: You awaken the sense of mortality in one creature you can see within range. The target must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or become frightened of you until the spell ends.

Ray of Enfeeblement: A black beam of enervating energy springs from your finger toward a creature within range. On a hit, the target deals only half damage with weapon attacks that use Strength for the duration.]

2nd Level Spells:[
Blindness/Deafness: You can blind or deafen a foe. Choose one creature that you can see within range to make a Constitution saving throw. If it fails, the target is either blinded or deafened for the duration.

Gentle Repose: You touch a corpse or other remains. For the duration, the target is protected from decay and can't become undead.]

Special Abilities:[
Siphon Soul: Frequency: Passive ability. Mechanics: The necromancer's spells that deal necrotic damage also siphon life energy back to them, regaining hit points equal to half the necrotic damage dealt.

Army of the Dead: Frequency: Once per long rest. Mechanics: Raise a number of fresh corpses to fight for you until destroyed. One summon per 3 levels up to a maximum of 3 minions.

Breath Weapon (Green Dragon Ancestry - Poison):
Frequency: Once per short or long rest.
Mechanics: As an action, exhale a 15-foot cone of poisonous gas. Each creature in the area must make a Constitution saving throw, taking 2d6 poison damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. The damage increases to 3d6 at 6th level, 4d6 at 11th level, and 5d6 at 16th level.]

Combat Stats:[
Hit Points: 45 (Max Hit Dice)
Armor Class: 12 (Robes + Dexterity Modifier)
Speed: 30 ft.
Attacks:
Necrotic quarterstaff: 1d8 bludgeoning damage plus 1d6 necrotic damage]
</character_sheet_necromancer>

entries.content:
<character_sheet_spellblade>
<notes on current campaign>
(This section is purely for keeping track of stat, spell, ability and item changes of the current campaign.)
Equipment:

Spell slots:

Spells:

Special abilities:

Misc notes:
</notes on current campaign>
Race: Human

Level: 5

Class: Spellblade (Fighter offshoot)

Background: Soldier

Alignment: Chaotic Neutral

Attributes:[
Strength: 16 (+3)
Dexterity: 12 (+1)
Constitution: 14 (+2)
Intelligence: 13 (+1)
Wisdom: 10 (+0)
Charisma: 8 (-1)]

Skills: Athletics, Intimidation

Equipment:[
One-Handed Sword
Chain Mail
Spell Component Pouch
Soldier's Pack
50 gold pieces]

Features and Traits:

Race: Human: +1 to all attributes
Class: Spellblade: Spellcasting, Arcane Combatant, One-Handed Casting, Blade Bond, War Magic
Background: Soldier: Military Rank, Feature: War Veteran

Spell slots:
Four 1st-level spell slots
Three 2nd-level spell slots

Spellcasting:
Cantrips:[
Greenflame Blade: As part of the action used to cast this spell, you make a melee attack with a weapon against one creature within the spell's range. If the attack hits, the target suffers the weapon attack's normal effects, and green fire envelops the blade. This inferno leaps to a second creature of your choice that you can see within 5 feet of it.
First Target Damage: 1d8 slashing + 1d6 fire damage.
Secondary Target Damage: 1d4 fire + Strength modifier damage.

Shocking Grasp: Lightning springs from your hand to deliver a shock to a creature you try to touch. Make a melee spell attack against the target. On a hit, the target takes 1d8 lightning damage, and it can't take reactions until the start of its next turn.]

1st Level Spells:[
Magic Missile:
At 1st level, you create three glowing darts of magical force. Each dart hits a creature of your choice that you can see within range. A dart deals 1d4 + 1 force damage to its target. The number of darts increases by one for every two spell levels above the first.
Spell Damage: 1d4 + 1 force damage per dart.
Scaling:
At 5th level (3rd spell slot), it creates five darts.
At 7th level (4th spell slot), it creates six darts, and so on.

Shield: An invisible barrier of magical force appears and protects you until the start of your next turn. You have a +5 bonus to AC, including against the triggering attack, and you take no damage from magic missile.]

2nd Level Spells:[
Blur: Your body becomes blurred, shifting and wavering to all who can see you. For the duration, any creature has disadvantage on attack rolls against you.

Scorching Ray: You create three rays of fire and hurl them at targets within range. You can hurl them at one target or several. Make a ranged spell attack for each ray. On a hit, the target takes 2d6 fire damage.]

Special Abilities:[
Arcane Combatant: Frequency: When you cast a cantrip. Mechanics: Perform a special melee attack as a bonus action. The melee attack deals an extra 1d8 damage of the cantrip's damage type.

Blade Bond: Frequency: Any time when you don't have your weapon. Mechanics: Bond with one weapon at a time; can summon it to your hand as long as it's on the same plane of existence.

War Magic: Passive Ability: After casting a spell, the Spellblade gains a +2 bonus to AC until the start of their next turn. ]

Combat Stats:[
Hit Points: 50
Armor Class: 16 (Chain Mail)
Speed: 30 ft.
Attacks:
One-Handed Sword: 1d8 +3 slashing damage]
</character_sheet_spellblade>
