entries.content:
[System Command: From the list below, award an item that is usable by the player.]

Wraithweave Cloak:[

Description: This ethereal cloak is made from the shadowy tendrils of wraiths and imbued with the essence of the Shadowfell. It billows and shifts like smoke, concealing the wearer from sight and granting protection against undead foes.
Stats Change: Wraithweave Cloak grants the wearer advantage on saving throws against spells and effects cast by undead creatures, as well as resistance to necrotic damage.
Armor Class: 11 + Dexterity modifier (max 2)]

Cloak of the Shadowcaster:[

Description: This dark cloak is infused with the essence of the Shadowfell, granting its wearer mastery over shadows and darkness. It billows ominously and seems to absorb light around it.
Stats Change: While wearing this cloak, the wearer gains advantage on Dexterity (Stealth) checks and can use an action to cast the darkness spell once per day.
Armor Class: 11 + Dexterity modifier]

lllusionist's Cloak:[

Description: This shimmering cloak is woven from threads of illusion magic, creating mesmerizing patterns and optical illusions. It allows its wearer to manipulate perception and deceive the senses.
Stats Change: Illusionist's Cloak grants the wearer advantage on saving throws against spells and effects that cause charm or fear, as well as resistance to psychic damage.
Armor Class: 11 + Dexterity modifier]

Conjurer's Cloak:[

Description: This voluminous cloak is adorned with arcane symbols and infused with the power of conjuration magic. It allows its wearer to summon creatures and objects from other planes of existence.
Stats Change: Conjurer's Cloak grants the wearer advantage on saving throws against spells and effects that cause sleep or unconsciousness, as well as resistance to force damage.
Armor Class: 11 + Dexterity modifier]

Cloak of Many Colors:[

Description: This vibrant cloak shimmers with iridescent hues, constantly shifting and changing colors. It grants the wearer a sense of whimsy and wonder, boosting their charisma in social situations.
Effect: Grants a +2 bonus to Charisma checks and allows the wearer to cast the prestidigitation cantrip once per day.]

Cloak of Billowing:[

Description: This dramatic cloak billows and flutters dramatically, even in the absence of wind. It enhances the wearer's presence and charisma, making them appear more imposing and heroic.
Effect: Grants advantage on Charisma (Intimidation) checks and allows the wearer to cast the gust cantrip at will to enhance the billowing effect.]

Cloak of Invisibility (to the Wearer):[

Description: This cloak renders the wearer completely invisible to themselves, granting them the ability to observe their surroundings without being seen. It offers a unique perspective on the world.
Effect: Grants the wearer the ability to become invisible to themselves at will, but they remain visible to others.]

Cloak of the Reaper's Embrace:[
Description: Woven from the death shroud of those who perished in agony, this cloak thrums with their unresolved fury. Its chilling touch seems to leech the warmth from the air, leaving a rime of frost wherever it lingers.
Stats Change: Grants the wearer a +1 bonus to all necrotic damage spells per undead minion under their control. Additionally, whenever the wearer is struck in melee, the attacker must make a Constitution saving throw or be cursed with a chilling malaise that saps their strength, imposing disadvantage on their next attack roll.]

Cloak of the Sanguine Ritual:[
Description: Drenched in the vestiges of blood magic rituals, this dark red cloak feels surprisingly heavy on the shoulders. It's as if the weight of lives taken in sacrifice lends power to its bearer.
Stats Change: The wearer can channel their own life force or that of others into bolstered power. As an action, they can choose to sacrifice hit points to add an equivalent amount to their next spell's damage (up to a maximum of 20 hit points), or transfer hit points to heal an undead minion or willing creature within touch.]

Cloak of the Healer:[
Description: Woven from purest white silk, embroidered with ancient symbols of life and vitality, this cloak seems to pulse with a soothing rhythm.
Effect: Healers wearing this cloak add a +2 bonus to all healing spell effects. Once per long rest, the wearer can cast 'mass cure wounds' at its base level without expending a spell slot.]

Cloak of the Iron Vanguard:[
Description: This heavy cloak is reinforced with interlaced iron threads, its surface charred like the aftermath of a great battle.
Effect: When a melee fighter dons this cloak, they gain damage reduction of 3 from all non-magical slashing, bludgeoning, and piercing attacks. Additionally, they gain an intimidation bonus equivalent to their Constitution modifier.]

Cloak of the Sharpshooter:[
Description: Crafted from a fabric as dark as a moonless night, this cloak aids ranged fighters in blending into the shadows.
Effect: Grants advantage on Dexterity (Stealth) checks for ranged fighters lying in wait. When attacking from stealth, their first hit deals an extra 2d6 damage.]

Cloak of Sanguine Shadows:[
Description: Dyed with the blood of the fallen, this cloak is said to grant the favor of shadowy patrons to those who walk the path of vengeance.
Effect: Once per day, the wearer can phase through solid objects for a short burst – up to 10 feet – as if a ghost seeking retribution. When emerging from the phase, their first melee attack is made with advantage.]

Boozemancer's Mantle:[
Description: A cloak saturated with the essence of myriad ales and wines, known to ferment enchantments as well as it does drinks.
Effect: Grants immunity to poison and advantage on saving throws against spells that alter consciousness, such as sleep or charm. The Boozemancer can tap into the cloak to regain one expended spell slot up to level 3 once per day.]

Spellblade's Veil:[
Description: Adorned with runic patterns, this cloak crackles with latent magic, ready to augment the Spellblade's enchanted weaponry.
Effect: Increases elemental damage (fire, cold, lightning) dealt by weapons by 1d4. Allows the wearer to, once per short rest, cast a shield spell as a reaction without expending a spell slot, reflecting the Spellblade's synergy with their magical defenses.]

Inquisitor's Drape:[
Description: Wrought from sacred fabrics and stitched with sigils of judgment, this cloak serves as both armor and a badge of authority.
Effect: Grants an aura of command, giving the Inquisitor advantage on Intimidation checks. It also provides resistance to damage from fiends and advantage on saving throws against effects from any creature with an alignment directly opposite of the Inquisitor's.]

Bastion's Embrace:[
Description: A cloak forged from dragonhide and tempered in the blood of heroes. Its surface is scarred from countless battles.
Effect: The wearer gains damage reduction of 5 from all non-magical attacks and gains advantage on saving throws against being frightened or knocked prone.]

Rogue's Shroud:[
Description: As dark as a moonless night, this cloak aids its wearer in eluding capture and silencing their footsteps.
Effect: Grants a +5 bonus to Dexterity (Stealth) checks and allows the wearer to become hidden as a bonus action once per short rest.]

Druid's Wrap:[
Description: Woven from the living vines and flowers of the sacred grove, this cloak is always in bloom, exuding the scent of wild nature.
Effect: The wearer gains the ability to speak with plants at will and can cast 'entangle' as a bonus action once per day.]

Cloak of the Blighted Swarm:[
Description: Swarming with insects from cursed swamps, this cloak appears to be alive, buzzing with malevolent intent.
Effect: The wearer can release a swarm to attack, once per day, dealing 1d8 poison damage to anyone within 5 feet. ]

{{user}} is rewarded a unique item that fits their class and/or skills. Dungeon master chooses from: {{random: unique_melee, unique_ranged, unique_staff, unique_trinkets, unique_shield, unique_armor, unique_cloth, unique_jewelry}}
</item_loot>
